programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sailing enthusiasts Andy and Dee look for a large holiday home in Spain, while a woman's insistence on bringing her pet parrot is complicating her property search in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple search for a home big enough for them and their eight children in Alicante, and the agency takes on a huge property that includes a luxurious cat hotel in the basement.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert visits Reigate in Surrey, where retired couple Lenny and Mary are struggling to secure a sale on their home. Phil also heads to Haslemere, where he meets Kimberley, an estate agent who is struggling to sell her own home.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three East Sussex couples compete for the £1,000 prize, including one pair who divide up the cooking and the hosting, and another duo who cannot seem to stop bickering.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north east of England compete for the £1,000 prize - first up are loved-up musicians Nick and Kelly, followed by Matthew and Katie, and Michael and Becky.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps workaholics David and Karen who cannot decide whether to buy a place to escape to in Dorset or the alpine city of Graz in Austria. Jasmine reveals what their £130,000 budget will get them in both locations.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary examining an espionage operation conducted to gather information on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. Shown to mark the 80th anniversary of the king's abdication, the programmes examines recently declassified documents revealing the extent of the surveillance and who ordered it, as well as featuring dramatic reconstructions and eyewitness accounts.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Following on from a pilot edition shown last Christmas, the Gogglesprogs return for a six-part run in which they maintain a close eye on a range of TV output, from entertainment shows and documentaries to some all-time classic films and up-to-the-minute news stories. Participants include six-year-old Molly and her eight-year-old brother William who both love helping out on the family farm, Stephanie who adores Justin Bieber and her friend Christina who prefers classical music, and schoolmates Jacob and Connor. In this opening programme, the youngsters offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on The Undateables, Donald Trump and Mamma Mia!.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: New series. Cameras follow the drama at Liverpool Women's Hospital, where Jodie, 19, found out that she was pregnant after she had a fling with Stephen, 22. He's determined to see his parental responsibilities through, including being at her bedside during a long labour. Also featured is 44-year-old Derroll, who met his wife Maria online. She's a mother of four and wants him to experience fatherhood for himself, but it's not without its challenges.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Self-confessed nerd Lachlan strikes gold when he sits down to eat with psychologist Rachel - who turns out to be an avid Star Wars fan. Nanny and part-time weightlifter Lucy hopes to pick up a new partner in the restaurant - and it seems as though charity administrator Caroline may be the one for her - while Alistair, who at 5ft 7 worries about his height, meets magazine editor Emily. Will he be talking tall after their date?.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan hears more inspirational stories of how some of the richest people in the UK and from around the world made their fortunes, discovering tales of hard graft, bizarre businesses and plucky entrepreneurship. the latest edition, the Canadian comedian meets a 22-year-old millionaire poker player, goes on a house hunt with former Big Brother contestant Aisleyne Horgan-Wallace, who is now a property mogul, and hangs out with a billionaire interior designer who has many celebrity clients.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Abel Morrison has three wives and 11 children, and his newest wife, Marina, is heavily pregnant, so it's a chaotic time for the family. However, while his first wife Suzie takes the challenges of plural marriage in her stride, his second wife Beth is struggling with Marina's demands on their husband's attention - and things come to a head on the day of the birth.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Joe DiDomizio, CEO of travel retailer Hudson Group, goes undercover to ensure the company is fighting fit for the future. The businessman hopes to find that the company's vow to be `the traveller's best friend' is being upheld by his employees.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Dave and Jenny deliver the giant fish sculpture to an expectant crowd and finally drop off the stained-glass windows. Then it is time to discover the the winner of Transporter of the Week.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple who are torn between two vibrant cities. While Cliff would like to move to Brighton, Sue dreams of living in Montpellier, southern France, where she would like to open a B&B.(n)

programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who struggled to find their first marital home, including Rupreet and Sundeep who had their hearts set on a specific area in Harrow. programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the complications of bereavement in the Rockland community. Melinda and Anazella's husband Jim recently died of cancer. His dying wish was for his brother Abel to marry his two widows and bring up his seven children - but Abel has three wives already, and the prospect of further upheaval is daunting for them. Although Jim's death has united Melinda and Anazella in grief, they must now choose whether to stay together as a family and risk living through the heartache of plural marriage again, or go their own way.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. This time, guest team captain David Walliams joins forces with Jonathan Ross, while Jon Richardson teams up with Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters.(n)

Drama based on VC Andrews' novel, starring Heather Graham and Ellen Burstyn.(n)

programme.title: Jonah Hex
programme.desc: A disfigured bounty hunter able to communicate with spirits of the dead is captured by the Government who offer him a deal. In return for his freedom, he must defeat a plan to take over the country that is being masterminded by the man who killed his family and left him horribly scarred. Fantasy Western, starring Josh Brolin and John Malkovich.(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Though ostensibly a family-oriented outing, Ivan Reitman's Kindergarten Cop ensures that fans of star Arnold Schwarzenegger's action films won't be disappointed by pumping up the Cop half of the equation to a surprisingly high degree. Schwarzenegger stars as John Kimble, an L.A. cop who learns that the ex-wife and son of his drug-dealer quarry Crisp (Richard Tyson) are living in secrecy in small-town Oregon. Kimble is partnered with Phoebe (Pamela Reed), a former teacher, who is slated to begin undercover work at the school where Crisp's ex is suspected of working under an assumed identity. However, Phoebe becomes ill, forcing rough, gruff Kimble to take over the kindergarten class instead(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Zany horror spoof about a talented brain surgeon trapped in marriage to a malicious wife whose affections are shared with everyone but her husband. A serial elevator killer is on the loose, and the good doctor finds himself in love with the disembodied brain of one of the killer's victims. All he needs is a body to put it in(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: Giddy, crowd-pleasing romp about an English teenager whose dreams of soccer stardom clash with the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: Like Lone Star, Sunshine State is a John Sayles film in which a multitude of characters struggle with the past, both recent and ancient -- both family history and the traumatic past of the land itself. It's set on the fictional Plantation Island in Florida, the history of which is based upon Amelia Island, where the film was actually shot. Lincoln Beach, the once thriving black community on the island, is based on the region's American Beach. Sunshine State portrays a relentless onslaught of real estate developers in the area. Desiree Perry (Angela Bassett, who was also in Sayles' Passion Fish and City of Hope) has returned to Florida for the first time since being sent away as a pregnant teen. She nervously brings her husband, Reggie (James McDaniel of NYPD Blue), an anesthesiologist, to meet her estranged mother, Eunice (Mary Alice). Eunice has recently taken in a troubled teenaged relative, Terrell (newcomer Alexander Lewis). Eunice's friend, Dr. Lloyd (Bill Cobbs), is trying to rally the Lincoln Beach community to slow development. Marly Temple (Edie Falco of The Sopranos, here playing a Southerner) runs the motel owned by her ailing father (Ralph Waite of Waltons fame), but has little interest in the business, and the developers are pressuring her to get her father to sell. She's in the process of ending a relationship with the local golf pro (Marc Blucas from TV's Buffy the Vampire Slayer), when a rather mercenary landscape architect, Jack Meadows (Timothy Hutton), catches her eye. Meanwhile, Francine Pickney (Mary Steenburgen) is so busy organizing the town's cheesy Buccaneer Days festival that she doesn't realize that her husband, Earl (Gordan Clapp, also of NYPD Blue and a Sayles regular) is suicidal. As usual, Sayles wrote, directed, and edited the film, with Maggie Renzi producing(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: A woman grows suspicious of her astronaut husband who acts strangely after returning from a space mission(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: In 1974 scientists mixed extraterestrial DNA with human DNA to create a new species. The creature, now a young girl, escapes and mutates into a beuatiful young woman intent on seducing unknowing men(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry in this intense thriller. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: A musician works with mobsters to advance his career but falls in love with the girlfriend of a gangland kingpin(n)

programme.title: The Crew
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds, Richard Dreyfuss, Dan Hedaya and Seymour Cassel star in this comedy about mobsters who come out of retirement for one last job. Facing eviction from the hotel where they live, the guys try to scare off the owners with a staged shooting. But the plan backfires, and a hilarious comedy of errors begins. Carrie-Anne Moss, Jennifer Tilly(n)

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: Flamboyant Hollywood remake of the 1979 French farce La Cage Aux Folles. When his son's conservative future in-laws come to town, gay club owner Armand and his cross-dressing partner Albert are forced to play husband and wife(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Jill Sprecher's film follows five New Yorkers whose lives intertwine, from eternal optimist Alan Arkin to his pessimistic colleague John Turturro, with Matthew McConaughey as a hot-shot lawyer whose life is derailed by a road accident(n)

programme.title: Riding in Cars With Boys
programme.desc: (2001) 125 mins (12) Drew Barrymore is a bright, ambitious teenager, determined to escape her working class background with parents James Woods and Lorraine Bracco. But on the rebound from a crush, she falls for and falls pregnant by Steve Zahn, an amiable but not-too-bright boy. At 16, she's a wife and a mother, still determined to finish college but weighed down by responsibility. Penny Marshall's film, told in flashback, is based on Beverly D'Onfrio's book of her struggle to become a writer(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie starring Wesley Snipes and Patrick Swayze about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team; Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man are among those recruited, each with a spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative Victorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman's dream marriage turns into a nightmare when she discovers her husband's violent nature and takes the decision to run away with her daughter. Pursued by her husband and his cronies, the woman eventually decides to fight back in a desperate bid to protect herself(n)

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Expert bouncer James Dalton is hired to clean up an out of control Missouri bar, locking horns with a local crime lord in the process(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays the eponymous hero in John Singleton's tough thriller, an ex-cop who sets out to nail Christian Bale, a killer using his rich kid connections to escape conviction. But as Shaft's net draws tighter, he has to contend with killers employed by a desperate Bale(n)

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: Set in the early 1970s, this biopic chronicles real-life Harlem drug kingpin Frank Lucas and the New York cop sworn to bring him down(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Art Ace.
programme.desc: The detective investigates the death of an art dealer in Manhattan's Little Korea, taking part in a seedy back-street poker game to find out more information about the murder, with the help of her father and his card game skills. Comedy drama, with Debra Messing and guest star Robert Klein.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of Richard Speigel, chief financial officer for an exclusive, family owned department store, results in the arrests of the shop staff - but the manager and father refuses to let his offspring take the blame, and goes all out to get them off the hook. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The case against a man accused of shooting the leader of the African-American Congress is jeopardised by the revelation that the prosecution's chief witness was once an informant for the FBI, and is still under their protection.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Hawkes is accused of killing someone in a bar-room brawl, and seemingly irrefutable evidence is produced against him. Mac and the team are taken off the case, but refuse to accept he is guilty and ponder whether anyone has a motive to frame him. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny answer a call reporting a body found in a peep-show booth. Gary Sinise and Hill Harper star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to the scene of a car accident in which a petty officer was killed. They discover a bullet wound in the body, as well as another victim at the bottom of a nearby ravine - a woman who was beaten to death. Ducky conducts an autopsy and makes a discovery that sets the agents off in search of a missing infant. Meanwhile, Tony is distracted by developments in his relationship with Jeanne.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: A heatwave creates havoc in the city, forcing the rookies to work around the clock to keep the peace. Andy fears a serial rapist may have resurfaced and is preying on teenage girls, and a sudden blackout forces him to tackle the predator alone.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Deemed Dealer.
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of a teenage boy who is mown down by a car as he walks through a rough neighbourhood, believing his death could be related to dealing drugs, before digging deeper into the dead teen's life. Comedy drama, starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is attacked and killed just hours after a serial rapist is freed on parole, prompting McCoy to pull out all the stops to bring him to justice - but before long the detective realises the wanted man could be innocent. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A carjacking turns nasty when an off-duty police officer is killed and the driver is kidnapped. Luckily, Briscoe and Curtis capture one of the perpetrators, who offers to reveal the whereabouts of the missing driver to DA Ross - in exchange for immunity on the cop-killing charge. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Stella fears she may have been infected with HIV-positive blood while conducting inquiries at a murder scene, and Danny investigates the case of a woman whose body has been found in a bath filled with water and rose petals, but has trouble establishing the cause of death. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby babysits a bright nine-year-old while the other members of the team try to locate the youngster's missing father - a survivalist wanted in connection with a case of robbery and murder. The search takes them deep into the wilderness - where a startling discovery awaits. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. The agents believe his erratic behaviour indicates post-traumatic stress disorder and try to calmly talk him round before restraining him. However, blood tests reveal high levels of steroids in his system - meaning someone is using him as a human lab rat. Starring Lauren Holly, Sean Murray and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: With Katie's whereabouts still unknown, Kelly interrogates Vince - the man who threatened him during the blackout - but he's stopped in his tracks by Detective Lindsay, who tells him to let the professionals do their job. As hours turn into days and with still no sign of his sister, the firefighter decides to take matters into his own hands. Casey knows passing her medical check-up is essential if she's to continue with her training, so she lies about the doctor's diagnosis.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Amaro's friend reports that his 14-year-old daughter is missing, and the detectives learn she is working as a prostitute - so they set up a sting operation to catch the pimp, and also arrest an ageing American football player. Starring Danny Pino and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the rape of an actress on stage during an interactive theatre production, only to discover the people in the audience - including her assailant - were all wearing masks. With no other leads, they are forced to track down an obsessive fan of the victim, who filmed the crime. Starring Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds: Suspect Behavior
programme.desc: The team tries to locate a serial killer who is kidnapping and hanging his victims as he travels across the country. Crime drama, starring Forest Whitaker and Beau Garrett.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The body of a celebrity is found at a party and the team discovers links with a mysterious gambling ring offering participants the chance to bet on the dates of famous people's deaths. Further investigation leads the officers to an offshore operation producing high-quality counterfeit banjoes. The forensic spin-off show's 100th episode, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Two male models are found dead in suspicious circumstances - and as the team interrogates the owners of the agency that employed them, dark secrets are exposed behind all the glitz and glamour of the fashion world. Meanwhile, Natalia's abusive ex-husband makes an unwelcome reappearance - and applies for a job at the morgue. Starring David Caruso and Eva La Rue.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Atwater and Burgess help a bewildered student who is found wandering the streets, only to discover she has 30 balloons filled with high-grade cocaine in her stomach - one of which has burst. Her story leads the unit on a frantic mission to find her three missing friends who are also being used as drug mules. Crime drama, starring Jason Beghe and Sophia Bush.(n)

programme.desc: The detective investigates the deaths of an elderly couple who disinherited their gay son after attempts to `cure' his sexuality failed. Meanwhile, Laura leaves this twins in the hands of a strict nanny called Alicia. Comedy drama, starring Debra Messing and Alysia Joy Powell.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An angry woman who blames her former daughter-in-law's new husband for her son's death hires a hitman to exact retribution. Briscoe and Curtis manage to get their hands on the contract killer but fail to understand why his customer has gone to such extreme lengths.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is murdered during an apparent road-rage incident, and the officers unravel a conspiracy involving arson. American crime drama starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and the team are called to a deaf family's home, where a woman has been shot and killed - a case that brings up memories of Lindsay's troubled past. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny investigate the murder of a promising figure-skater who has been found dead at the ice rink - and come to suspect she was not the intended target. Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Anna Belknap star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Lt Col Mann arrives to assist with inquiries into the murder of a marine - a case that becomes personal for Gibbs when he learns one of the witnesses is his ex-wife Stephanie. The team discovers the prime suspect was having an affair with the dead man's spouse, but the case is complicated by the revelation that the victim may have been selling top-secret military information. Starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: Andy and Chris face a difficult decision while investigating a nightclub beating when evidence suggests a cop is the likely perpetrator. Meanwhile, the senior officers compete in a retraining exercise led by new acting sergeant Frank Best.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Popped Pugilist.
programme.desc: Laura and the team investigate when a female impersonator is found shot dead in his car, and quickly discover that the victim was part of an underground fight club. Billy and Meredith go undercover to find out more about a woman seen wearing the same orange lipstick found in the vehicle belonging to the dead man, but soon turn their attention toward a man who claimed to be the deceased's real manager. Starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives probe the shooting of a motorist, and arrest a man who helped the victim change a tyre on his car shortly before he was killed. The suspect protests his innocence, and points the investigators in the direction of another man who admits to the crime and even signs a confession, but further inquiries cast doubt on his guilt. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the death of a book editor who was reputedly having an affair with one of her authors, and find themselves focusing on the lover's long-time companion, whose alibi turns out to be a tissue of lies. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and Danny try to catch the killer of a conman whose body has been found lying in a pile of money - a mystery compounded by the discovery that he had been building an ark in his back garden. Across the city, Stella and Flack examine the body of a man dressed in a cigarette costume who appears to have burned to death, and follow a trail that leads to the headquarters of a tobacco company.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: A prisoner transfer goes awry and a notorious paedophile escapes from custody. programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: The Glimmer Man
programme.desc: Action thriller about a government agent who is asked to resume his old role as a police officer to help catch a serial killer preying on the citizens of LA. Teamed with a local homicide detective, the agent discovers that the killer seems to know a lot about his past(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once again send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but Lee's shock at coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower. Also starring Youki Kudoh and Noémie Lenoir, together with, in unlikely cameos, Max von Sydow and Roman Polanski(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Adventurer Rick O'Connell fights to prevent a resurrected Chinese emperor taking over the world. Action sequel(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Suspecting their new house may be haunted, a distressed couple call in a pair of top paranormal experts to investigate. Horror(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Frank Martin will transport everything - for a price. Ice cool under pressure and a brilliant driver, he makes only one mistake: opening a wriggling package to reveal a kidnapped Chinese girl(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Based on a series of books by Patrick O'Brian, MASTER AND COMMANDER plunges viewers deep into the story of a British Navy ship at sea during the Napoleonic war. Russell Crowe stars as Aubrey, the charismatic captain who wrestles with issues like honour, pride, duty, sacrifice and loyalty while using ingenious tactics to engage his prey--a much larger and better-equipped French Man o' War. Paul Bettany plays his friend, the ship's doctor(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel) and his tight-knit gang of street racers must battle the brother of a defeated nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists. The film is dedicated to series regular Paul Walker, who died halfway through production(n)

programme.title: Highlander
programme.desc: When a young warrior fails to die from a fatal wound he's banished in the highlands of sixteenth-century Scotland. He soon learns though that he is part of an immortal race. Centuries later in New York he must fight his ultimate enemy to become the last of his kind(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: When hippie-esque psycho Scorpio goes on a killing spree, Inspector Harry Callahan and new partner Chico are assigned to hunt him down, but not before the Mayor and Lt. Bressler admonish Callahan about his heavy-handed tactics(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: A box office smash and written by Slyvestor Stallone as the version of 'Beverly Hills Cop' he wanted to make. Based on the novel 'Fair Game' and also stars Brigitte Nielsen(n)

programme.title: Paper Towns
programme.desc: In this moving coming-of-age tale, a nerdy teen falls for the enigmatic girl next door, who vanishes after the two have an adventure together one night. She leaves behind a trail of clues, which lead him and his pals to go on a road trip to find her(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: The final instalment in this hugely successful trilogy, takes place in Hollywood during production of "Stab 3, Return To Woodsboro". The production is a thriller which raises troubling questions about the events that terrified Woodsboro and continue to haunt Sidney Prescott. Three and a half years after leaving Windsor College, Sidney has settled in to a life of quiet seclusion in Northern Carolina. But that uneasy peace is shattered when terror erupts on the set of "Stab 3". Hotshot TV presenter Gale Weathers is called to the scene by the LAPD as the ultimate expert on the previous murders, and is reunited with Dewey. Will they survive to tell the tale this time?(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Max Payne is a widowed cop hell-bent on delivering justice no matter what the cost as he investigates a string of killings in his city(n)

programme.title: The Gallows
programme.desc: High-school students restage a play that ended in horrific tragedy in order to honour the 20th anniversary of the event. However, they soon realise that their plan is a deadly mistake(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Victor Salva's superior horror film stars Gina Philips and Justin Long as bickering siblings driving from college across America. Pulling over to investigate a parked truck that had previously tried to run them off the road, they see a strangely garbed figure dumping what looks like a dead body. Investigating, they stumble across an ancient, indestructible horror and look set to become the next victims, unless the advice of psychic Patricia Belcher can save them(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A strange videotape begins making the rounds in a town in the Pacific Northwest; it is full of bizarre and haunting images, and after watching it, many viewers receive a telephone call in which they are warned they will die in seven days. A handful of teenagers who watched the tape while spending a weekend at a cabin in the mountains scoff at the threat, but as predicted, they all die suddenly on the same night(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller about a sleazy book dealer endeavouring to locate a rare occult work. The dealer is hired by a wealthy bibliophile to locate the two remaining copies of a 17th-century book entitled The Nine Gates to the Kingdom of Shadows. As he travels from New York to Madrid and Paris, he learns that the book is rumoured to have been written by the Devil - and to contain the key to conjuring him up(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: An astronaut returns to earth infected with alien DNA and impregnates unsuspecting women. Humanity's only hope is a clone of a seductive alien hybrid who must track down the astronaut before his extraterrestrial offspring overrun the planet. Nastasha Henstridge, Michael Madsen, Marg Helgenberger, Justin Lazard(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: Paramedics race to help a young girl with breathing difficulties on the Isle of Man and every second counts for the Cornwall Air Ambulance rescuing an elderly man with an aneurysm.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters explore properties in Staffordshire, Essex and Monmouthshire, then speak to buyers including a first-time developer and a builder planning a new home for his fiancee.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers deal with squatters in central London - and things get physical when some refuse to leave. Lawrence and Kev try to find out if a garage has gone into liquidation.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates the bogus car accessories flooding the UK market. Plus, the story of how a counterfeit insurance document led to disaster.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Thomas Plant and Christina Trevanion help two teams search for bargains at Staffordshire County Showground. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott oversees the day's proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha assumes the worst after learning Karl is wanted by the police, Karen does some digging on JJ, and Sid treats a dementia patient who does not have long left.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: A family of three try to work out the three-digit code to crack open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright asks the questions in the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple wanting to relocate to the Gloucestershire countryside with a budget of £550,000, and explores the extraordinary collection of an English eccentric.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues three items from the tip in Walsall, including a rusty lathe for Guy Trench to clean up, and an old toilet door, which Daniel Heath tries to work his magic on.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Will Axon and Philip Serrell visit Ickworth House, a Georgian mansion in Suffolk built for the Earls of Bristol, where the team picks out a selection of interesting items to be sold at auction. Will casts an appreciative eye over a piece of Martinware, but a miniature long case clock bought at the car boot for £1 could prove to be the star find. Plus, Paul heads to the Suffolk coast to explore a fantasy holiday village built in the early 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Tina receives a helping hand from an unlikely friend, while Bex continues to reel from recent events. Lauren tells Max she intends to apply for a job at his company - and despite his advice to look elsewhere, she is determined to stick to her guns.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Eight more amateurs are given just 80 minutes to devise one dish using ingredients available in the MasterChef market. On offer today are duck legs, ox tail, lamb mince, langoustine, cod and scallops. The stakes are high as three hopefuls will be sent home, while the remaining five have to cook two courses to impress not just John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also two previous champions - Ping Coombes (2014) and Thomasina Miers (2005) - and 2006 finalist Dean Edwards.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin and the team continue to explore the archipelago, much of which still remains a mystery to science. The presenter ventures far beneath the waves in a deep-sea submersible in search of an elusive ocean giant, the mola or sunfish, to understand more about its little-known behaviour. She also sees how sea lions have been affected by the El Nino weather phenomenon, before the team sails north for the most remote and inhospitable islands in the Galapagos - Wolf and Darwin, where Liz helps tag and track hammerhead sharks that school at this location.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Gillingham in Kent, where the panel comprises Conservative MP Suella Fernandes, Shadow Home Secretary Diane Abbott, Liberal Democrat leader Tim Farron, co-leader of the Green Party Jonathan Bartley, businesswoman and broadcaster Michelle Dewberry, and West Midlands Secretary of the Unite union Gerard Coyne.(n)

programme.title: The National Pet Service
programme.desc: A revealing look at the work of the People's Dispensary for Sick Animals, which has been helping those facing economic hardship to look after their pets for the past 100 years. Those struggling to afford private pet fees include boxing coach Tony, whose tough guy exterior belies his love for an overweight spaniel named Sophie, and retired hairdresser Angie, whose cat Leo helps her feel less alone in the world and has film star good looks.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Countryside 999
programme.desc: HMS Gannet's search and rescue squadron makes a dangerous flight to the cloud-covered summit of Goatfell mountain on the Isle of Arran to locate two missing hill walkers. In Hereforshire, a tip-off to police has officers going in search of an illegal shotgun, and on the Isle of Man paramedics help a woman with a mysterious and extreme allergic reaction. Narrated by Ralph Ineson.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a house in Bury, Greater Manchester, a ground-floor flat in London's Grove Park and an 1820s cottage in Cardiff. After the properties are auctioned, they then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Tommy and Craig attempt to recover more than £10,000 owed to a couple who bought a boat that turned out to be a wreck. Lawrence and Kev encounter some seriously heavy goods.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: The counterfeit horse passports putting young riders in danger, and the full story of the high street furniture that is also a fire hazard. Presented by Matt Allwright.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning travels by steam to the Elsecar Heritage Centre in South Yorkshire, where Kate Bliss and Jonathan Pratt help two teams scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karl visits Jimmi to try to get the bottom of his problems, Karen worries about Mrs Tembe, Ruhma deals with an extended labour, while Zara has enough of Valerie trailing Daniel.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which two long-term friends from Middlesbrough answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple, who have spent the last 20 years living in France and now wish to relocate to Devon. Sonali also explores one of the county's most celebrated rivers.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A broken Ercol coffee table requires extreme expertise to redeem it, while artisan bag maker Neil Wragg has to use all of his creativity to rethink an old bicycle.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as the team values antiques at the Museum of Science and Industry in Manchester. Anita Manning and Michael Baggott examine items including a French book of butterflies and an Inuit carving. Plus, a look at a rare and beautiful art book that is contested at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon hosts the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in the light-hearted quiz, with golfer Matt Fitzpatrick, England bowler Steve Finn, former World Champion swimmer Mark Foster and long jumper Jazmin Sawyers joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The residents rally together for the sponsored bike ride to raise money for the fayre, but what should be fun is anything but for one local after an upsetting realisation. Meanwhile, Tina excitedly prepares for Shirley's return home from prison.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Restaurant critic William Sitwell sets the brief as John Torode and Gregg Wallace introduce the second quarter-final, from which the best contestants go through to Knockout Week. His challenge for the amateur cooks is to make an exceptional dish, either cooking a savoury recipe that has no meat or fish, or a tart dessert. After preparing their dish, the candidates must stand before William, John and Gregg and hear what they think of their offering and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: Decline and Fall
programme.desc: Wealthy and beautiful widow Margot Beste-Chetwynde's world is one in which Paul is not overly comfortable. A socialite, her glamorous home is almost constantly filled with the fashionable upper echelons of society, leaving him struggling to adapt to the environment, while striving to win her heart. Perhaps most importantly, he also wonders whether Margot is all that she seems. Jack Whitehall, David Suchet, Eva Longoria and Douglas Hodge star in James Wood's adaptation of Evelyn Waugh's comic novel.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: New series. Just a month following the end of his last run, the diminutive Irishman returns with a brand now run of 13 shows. Here, Graham catches up with Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman, stars of new heist comedy Going in Style. Plus, comedian Jack Whitehall and Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan talk about their roles in BBC One's Evelyn Waugh adaptation, Decline and Fall. The nation's favourite man band Take That feature, while Graham also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good.(n)

programme.title: Witless
programme.desc: New series. Leanne and Rhona learn a corrupt cop has leaked their safe house location, leaving them with no choice but to go on the run. Kerry Howard and Zoe Boyle star.(n)

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: A ruthless TV boss suffers a nervous breakdown and is persuaded to relocate to an idyllic town. However, she begins to suspect something is very wrong with the local women and sets out to discover the dark secret behind the seemingly perfect community. Frank Oz's comedy remake of the 1975 satire, with Nicole Kidman, Matthew Broderick, Bette Midler, Glenn Close and Christopher Walken.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team offer advice on making money from travel related antiques and collectibles, while Paul Martin explores the history of the bicycle.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers confront a man who has not paid the rent he owes to a single mother, and agent Lawrence is on the trail of the £30,000 owed by a financial advisor.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey, including a copper hopper funnel, a bedside table and an old mirror and washstand.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts his plans for his revamped courtyard garden, when he plants bare root trees and gives advice on climbers that will happily grow on east-facing walls. Nick Bailey explores the strange world of lichens and finds out how these plants grow and thrive on trees, wood and stone, while Frances Tophill meets the enthusiastic gardeners of Barbados who fill their gardens with colour, foliage and world class flowers. As part of the programmes 50th anniversary, Rachel de Thame reveals the plant she thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland: Dromod to Sligo.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Irish journey from Dromod to Sligo. Along the way he discovers how the landscape inspired the poet WB Yeats and learns to make a potato pancake.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Westminster in review
programme.desc: Keith Macdougall presents the highlights from Parliament since January including the terror attack on Parliament, the Brexit legislation, the U-Turn Budget, Labour lose a long-held seat at a by-election, the House of Lords stars in its own series, the collapse of the Northern Ireland Executive, the Scottish Government demands a new referendum on independence and the Speaker tells Donald Trump he's not welcome at Westminster.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: The Strictly Come Dancing judge takes Homes Under the Hammer presenter Lucy Alexander back to Herne Bay in Kent to reminisce about a holiday she had in 1979.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Irish comedian Brendan O'Carroll, best known as his alter ego Mrs Brown and star of the BBC sitcom Mrs Brown's Boys, tries to find out the truth about his grandfather's murder, and attempts to uncover the identities of the men responsible. Shopkeeper Peter O'Carroll was killed in October 1920 at the height of the Irish War of Independence, and the Dublin-born actor begins his journey of discovery with only a newspaper article from the time and the words `shot during the curfew' from Peter's gravestone.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Equine vet Sybil has to contend with a Highland cow in Teesdale, Co Durham, while treating Fell ponies, and Steve judges a dog competition at the local Bowes Agricultural Show. Meanwhile, Angela has to break bad news to the owner of a Rottweiler at Fife's small animal hospital. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Examining how animals, including monkeys, wolves, bears, foxes and birds, cope with mountain life in the Himalayas, and how the harsh terrain has given many creatures remarkable strength. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals
programme.sub-title: David Attenborough's Rise of Animals: Triumph of the Vertebrates: Dawn of the Mammals.
programme.desc: The naturalist concludes his exploration of the evolution of vertebrates over the past 500 million years by looking at the history of mammals. He traces their journey from humble origins as tiny nocturnal forest-dwellers to their astonishing explosion in diversity and domination of the world following the death of the dinosaurs.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant shop around Warwickshire and Essex, visiting a Battle of Britain airshow before heading for auction in Winchcombe, Gloucestershire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Lawrence, Kansas, Michael Portillo joins the Jayhawks basketball team in the famous Allen Field house stadium with energetic encouragement from their cheerleaders, before travelling through Tornado Alley to Topeka to meet one of the first storm chasers in America. Driving out on the Great Plains, Michael learns about the Tallgrass Prairie and comes face to face with a herd of wild buffalo.(n)

programme.title: Alone with the In-Laws
programme.desc: Chris and Stacey from Bristol are getting married in the summer, and while planning for the big day is one thing, making a success of the years that follow is another. To help out, the Rev Kate Bottley comes up with an idea - they will spend a few days living alone with their respective in-laws-to-be, to find out what they can learn about each other from the people who raised them. After four days, will the couple still feel the same about trying the knot?.(n)

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: Guthred's lack of judgement has divided Northumbria, so Uhtred must travel North to defeat the brothers Erik and Sigefrid, take back Eoferwic and reassert the king's authority. Alfred sends Aethelwold to join the riding party, believing he can remind Guthred of his duty to Wessex - but Aethelwold's judgement becomes clouded. Meanwhile, a confrontation with the Northmen brings a shocking turn of events, and hostility is rife when Sven attempts to reason with Thyra.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Ed Gamble, Sara Pascoe and John Robins join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the events of October 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Sabine Schmitz compete in a buggy race across the Californian desert that is one of the toughest events in motorsport, and Matt LeBlanc test drives new supercar the Ford GT.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear: Extra Gear
programme.desc: George Lewis and Rory Reid go off-road UK-style with the help of two British King of the Hammers drivers. Chris Harris gets his hands on the Nissan GTR, and Eddie Jordan and Sabine Schmitz reminisce about King of the Hammers and their Ultra4 experience.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Philippe returns from war a changed man, while the debauched urges of dissident duke Cassel must be pandered to by Madame de Montespan as Louis prepares for a lavish celebration in the palace gardens. Sacrifices are required in this episode of the period drama depicting the decadent and turbulent early reign of King Louis XIV. Supported by Inside Versailles documentary shorts. Starring George Blagden, Alexander Vlahos, Tygh Runyan, Stuart Bowman, Amira Casar and Evan Williams.(n)

programme.title: Dame Vera Lynn: Happy 100th Birthday
programme.desc: Katie Derham makes use of archive footage and family records to tell the story of how Vera Lynn came to become one of the UK's most well-known musical stars. Vera celebrates her 100th birthday on March 20th, and marks the occasion by reminiscing about her early days in showbusiness, with help from her daughter Virginia. She recalls starting out as Vera Welch in the 1920s, first appearing on stage at the tender age of seven, before charming the nation's servicemen and becoming the `forces sweetheart' during the Second World War. She also remembers becoming the first British artist to achieve a number one in America in the 1950s, and a similar feat in 2009, when she became the oldest living singer to reach the same position in the UK charts. Along the way, Second World War veterans and entertainment industry figures - including Paul McCartney, Barry Humphries and Miriam Margolyes - pay tribute to the power of her voice.(n)

programme.title: Britain at War: Imperial War Museums at 100
programme.desc: Falklands War veteran and charity campaigner Simon Weston marks 100 years since the establishment of the Imperial War Museums, which were initially set up in 1917 - in the midst of the First World War - to pay tribute to civil and military sacrifices during times of conflict. First housed at the Crystal Palace in London, over the past century, the organisation has expanded, comprising five sites across Britain. In this programme Weston examines 10 key objects from the IWM's collection, with help from special `advocates' who explore each artefact's story. Includes contributions by Bear Grylls, Al Murray, Cornelia Parker, Steve McQueen, Kate Adie, Kelly Holmes and Anita Rani.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the show's experts explore the pros and cons of parting company with heirlooms that have been gathering dust in the attic, while Thomas Plant reveals the incredible family saga behind Martin Brothers stoneware pottery.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The officers deal with squatters in central London - and things get physical when some refuse to leave. Lawrence and Kev try to find out if a garage has gone into liquidation.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades rescues three items from the tip in Walsall, including a rusty lathe for Guy Trench to clean up, and an old toilet door, which Daniel Heath tries to work his magic on.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: The presenter follows innovative businesses in the Lake District through Spring, Summer and Autumn, painting portrait of the rugged landscape and gaining an insight the challenges they face. Kate Humble helps with lambing at a fifth generation farm who have invented the world's only wool compost, so they can keep their farming traditions alive. She also goes foraging for wild food, which went to waste until one woman realised she could turn it into unique jams and preserves that are now sold nationwide. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: France v Great Britain: Day One.
programme.desc: France v Great Britain. Sue Barker presents coverage of the opening day of the World Group quarter-final, featuring the first two singles rubbers at the Kindarena in Rouen. France have chosen to play this tie on an indoor clay surface and Britain will be without world number one Andy Murray, who has not recovered from the illness and injuries that have restricted his play this year.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Highlights: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents action from the opening day at the Augusta National in Georgia, where England's Danny Willett entered as the reigning champion at the first Major of the year. The Sheffield golfer recorded a stunning victory here in 2016 to claim his first Major title and become the first British winner of the event since Nick Faldo in 1996. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Andrew Cotter and Paul Azinger.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don offers advice on the best apples and pears to grow in small spaces when he begins to plant up his new fruit garden and gets on with planning for colour when he adds some summer flowering bulbs. As April gets underway, Carol Klein chooses the primrose as her plant of the month and the programme meets a couple from Yorkshire who have a passion for growing fruit and have filled their garden with over 100 fruit trees. As part of the programme's 50th anniversary, Joe Swift makes the case for his Golden Jubilee plant, the one he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the final, in which the two most successful teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked. One set of clues comprises The Property of a Lady, The Hildebrand Rarity, Risico and 007 in New York. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The giant armadillo, an animal so elusive few have ever seen it wild in the Brazilian wetlands region known as the Pantanal. David Attenborough reveals how the burrows the armadillos dig create homes for hundreds of other animals. Until recently man knew virtually nothing of this species, but Arnaud Desbiez, the founder of the Giant Armadillo Project, has changed all that.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Sarah Millican, Eddie Kadi, Noel Fielding and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry mucks about with a messy mixture of M-themed matters. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the final heat, with reigning champion Apollo taking on rival contenders Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'n'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide through two group battles and a mini-league. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from July 14, featuring Paul Young, Elvis Costello and the Attractions, Heaven 17, Bananarama and Echo and the Bunnymen. Presented by Peter Powell and Andy Peebles.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: A Very British Map: The Ordnance Survey Story.
programme.desc: The history of a quintessentially British institution, which was formed in 1791, originally for military reasons before becoming a valuable tool in peacetime for ramblers and adventurers. Timeshift examines how the OS is adjusting to the digital age, with the large folding maps now just a small part of its output.(n)

programme.title: Mary Magdalene: Art's Scarlet Woman
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak explores how the image of Mary Magdalene has been invented and re-invented by artists from Caravaggio to Cezanne, Ruben to Rembrandt and Titian to Van Gogh.(n)

programme.title: Roof Racks and Hatchbacks: The Family Car
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the British experience of the family car, from the groundbreaking Morris Minor to the ubiquitous Ford Cortina, and the Range Rover to the new Jaguar F-Pace. The film looks at how designers have long endeavoured to make the family car attractive, even exciting, and to keep pace as the family and its requirements have evolved over the decades. Narrated by Grace Dent.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis traces the history of one of the world's most famous trade routes, which ran from China's ancient capital Xian through the cities of central Asia and Persia. He begins his travels in Venice, examining how the architecture was shaped by Eastern influences, before arriving in China's ancient capital Xian where he discovers how a single deal to trade silk for war horses created a global network.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from July 14, featuring Paul Young, Elvis Costello and the Attractions, Heaven 17, Bananarama and Echo and the Bunnymen. Presented by Peter Powell and Andy Peebles.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: A Very British Map: The Ordnance Survey Story.
programme.desc: The history of a quintessentially British institution, which was formed in 1791, originally for military reasons before becoming a valuable tool in peacetime for ramblers and adventurers. Timeshift examines how the OS is adjusting to the digital age, with the large folding maps now just a small part of its output.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long introduce an edition of the show from July 28, featuring performances by KC and the Sunshine Band, Elvis Costello and the Attractions, the Lotus Eaters, Malcolm McLaren, Robert Plant and Bananarama.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: Contest showcasing the very best of British dance talent, culminating in a grand final to be staged at Sadler's Wells. Contenders Anaya Bolar, Shyam Dattani, Jaina Modasia, Akshay Prakash and Anjelli Wignakumar showcase two of the most popular classical Indian dance styles - Kathak and Bhatanatyam. Judging this South Asian category are choreographer, performer and academic Chitra Sundaram, performer, teacher and leading exponent of Kathak dance Kajal Sharma, and choreographer and dance producer Shobana Jeyasingh. Hosted by Anita Rani.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back at past performances by the band, who emerged from the UK's post-punk scene over three decades ago. From their first appearance on Top of the Pops in 1981 to performing on Later with Jools Holland in 2009, this programme shares archive testimony and recent interviews from core members Dave Gahan, Vince Clarke, Martin Gore and Andy Fletcher. New Life, Just Can't Get Enough, Blasphemous Rumours and Personal Jesus are among some of the classic hits performed.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode at 6Music Festival 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the band's headlining performance in Glasgow, playing the iconic Barrowland Ballroom on the last Sunday in March. The band's first live UK show in four years saw them perform tracks from their new album Spirit, along with some classic hits. The last time Dave Gahan, Martin Gore and Andy Fletcher performed at the 2,000 capacity venue was in 1984 for their Some Great Reward tour.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode 101
programme.desc: DA Pennebaker's documentary following the Basildon band as they prepare for the final date of their Music for the Masses tour at the Pasadena Rose Bowl in California in 1989. The film charts how their profile increased during the late 1980s, leading to them becoming one of the most popular alternative rock acts in the world, and also follows a group of young fans travelling across the USA by bus to attend the concert.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant's mummified body is found 10 years after his disappearance, prompting renewed interest in the case. Declared a deserter, he was given a dishonourable discharge - chiefly because $1million went missing from his ship's safe on the day he vanished. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs, Tony and Kate board an aircraft carrier to investigate the deaths of two crewmen who appear to have overdosed, even though the pair had no history of drug use. At first the inquiry seems doomed to failure - until training tapes offer an unlikely lead. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Sloan's insufferable sister discovers a dead estate estate agent in her new house - and the medical sleuth's investigation throws up no shortage of suspects. Dick Van Dyke stars.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A mountain man has to stand trial after being accused of three murders.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hop Sing falls in love with a woman he meets panning for gold on his holidays, but his heart is broken when a judge confirms the law prohibits interracial marriage.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A shark caught off the Miami coast is found to contain a human torso bearing a bullet wound. A tattoo leads the team to suspect the victim was a political refugee from Cuba - and the discovery of a second victim, fatally shot in the thigh, confirms the theory. David Caruso stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate the murder of an engineer working on highly sensitive submarine technology, but find the crime scene clean of evidence. Forensic scientist Abby Sciuto travels from the NCIS office in Washington, DC to help out as the case has similarities to a serial killer she has been tracking. Guest starring Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: The IMF team take on the task of undermining communist warmonger Janos Karq, and are sent to work with memory expert Joseph Baresh. However, things don't go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Sturgis defends a retired sailor whose case dates back to the Second World War, when he and 49 comrades in arms were charged with mutiny and court-martialled for requesting more stringent safety procedures. As the last surviving member of the team, he wants his record cleared before he dies.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team delves into Vance's troubled past in a desperate effort to trap a vengeful female assassin named Lee Wuan Kai. Although she is determined to strike back at him by targeting his family, it gradually transpires that there is another deeper motive for her crimes. Crime drama, guest starring Kelly Hu, with Mark Harmon, Rocky Carroll and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: A successful boxer is found murdered shortly after a bout, so Jack steps into the ring to catch the culprit. Detective drama, starring Dick Van Dyke and Scott Baio.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: The ranger gets involved when a vengeful group of police officers are revealed to be murdering criminals who are set free on technicalities. Adventure with the modern-day lawman whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam investigate when former marine Asher Ross is killed by an explosive device hidden in his mobile phone. Because of the sophisticated nature of the bomb, suspicion falls on the members of the ordnance disposal unit Ross was part of in Iraq, but further enquiries reveal that they are being targeted as well.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team's inquiries into a case of rape and murder lead to a prominent Florida dynasty and its steely patriarch. However, when investigations reveal he was a code-breaker involved in naval intelligence, Callen and Sam dig deeper and gradually unearth links to Safar, a Libyan-born terrorist known to recruit on behalf of al-Qaeda. Henri Lubatti guest stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Megan, Calleigh and Speedle take on the case of a murdered priest, focusing their attention on an altar boy - whose father is later found dead. Meanwhile, Horatio and Eric investigate a fatal explosion in a car driven by a pregnant woman, and try to uncover the identity of her baby's father. Drama, starring David Caruso, Kim Delaney, Khandi Alexander and Emily Procter.(n)
