programme.desc: Strong Arms of the Ma. After being mugged at the Kwik-E-Mart, Marge gets agoraphobia and hides out in the basement where she finds Homer's old weights set and decides to beef up(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Smart & Smarter. Simon Cowell plays an admissions interviewer at a prestigious pre-nursery school where Maggie's IQ is found to surpass Lisa's, causing an identity crisis for the older sister. Yeardley Smith, Tress MacNeille, Julie Kavner(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Bel Panto: Part I. Part 1 of 2. A fundraiser goes awry due to party crashers(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Bel Panto: Part II. Archer and Lana go missing as a hostage situation gets out of control(n)

programme.title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
programme.desc: An American schoolteacher volunteers to fight with a brigade of Republican soldiers during the Spanish Civil War, and is given the task of bombing a strategic bridge behind enemy lines. Oscar-winning drama based on the novel by Ernest Hemingway, starring Gary Cooper, Ingrid Bergman and Katina Paxinou.(n)

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma
programme.desc: A US Marine unit fighting in the Pacific is ordered to capture Japanese troops so they can be interrogated for information about a new weapons base - but the mission proves even more difficult than expected. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Reginald Gardiner, Robert Wagner and Karl Malden.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: A Victorian veterinary surgeon is certified insane after developing the ability to talk to his patients in their own language. Undaunted, he manages to escape from the asylum and embarks on a quest to locate a rare aquatic snail. Oscar-winning musical comedy, with Rex Harrison, Samantha Eggar, Richard Attenborough and Anthony Newley. Songs include Talk to the Animals and I've Never Seen Anything Like It.(n)

programme.title: Never Been Kissed
programme.desc: A clumsy 25-year-old would-be reporter is given the chance to prove herself when she is sent on an assignment to get an inside take on high-school life. However, when she falls for an English teacher, she has trouble maintaining the facade of a calm and sophisticated young lady, as all the bad memories of her awkward younger days come flooding back. Romantic comedy, with Drew Barrymore, Michael Vartan and David Arquette.(n)

programme.title: The Woman in Black: Angel of Death
programme.desc: Premiere. A group of evacuees and their teachers hope to find peace by escaping the nightly air raids on London at the remote Eel Marsh House. What they do not realise is that its malevolent ghost is still in residence and is out for blood. Horror sequel set during the Second World War, starring Helen McCrory, Jeremy Irvine and Phoebe Fox.(n)

programme.title: American Hustle
programme.desc: A conman is caught in the act by the FBI, but a maverick agent offers him the chance to escape prison by assisting in a sting operation. The hustler finds himself involved in a scheme to bring down the corrupt, Mafia-affiliated politician, only to find his own ex-wife plotting revenge. Crime drama set in the 1970s, starring Christian Bale, Amy Adams, Bradley Cooper and Jennifer Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Metro Manila
programme.desc: A man from the mountains of the Northern Philippines brings his family to Manila hoping to find a better life. He gets a job, but soon discovers his boss is involved in criminal activity, and is torn between following his conscience and the need to support his family. Drama, starring Jake Macapagal and Althea Vega. In Tagalog.(n)

programme.title: Comanche
programme.desc: A powerful Native American chief agrees to take part in peace talks with Washington after an encounter with a sympathetic scout. However, a group of renegade warriors are unwilling to surrender their arms and their actions prompt a bigoted government official to use brutal methods. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Kent Smith, Nestor Paiva and Henry Brandon.(n)

programme.title: Aces High
programme.desc: A new recruit is proud to join the Royal Flying Corps' elite 76 Squadron under the command of a renowned ace, but is shocked to discover his superior officer has turned to drink as the high fatalities among his men take their toll - with devastating consequences for the pilots. First World War drama, starring Malcolm McDowell, Christopher Plummer, Simon Ward and Peter Firth.(n)

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: An eccentric Victorian inventor discovers a strange material that defies gravity and uses it to build the world's first spaceship. Leading an expedition to the moon, he is astonished to discover it is inhabited by giant ants and caterpillar-like creatures. Sci-fi adventure based on HG Wells' novel, starring Lionel Jeffries, Edward Judd, Martha Hyer and Miles Malleson, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cleo
programme.desc: A captured Briton is mistaken for a heroic swordsman and promoted to the Roman Royal Guard, with orders to protect Julius Caesar. But the last thing he and the fated emperor expect is an assassination attempt from within Caesar's own circle of friends. Comedy, starring Amanda Barrie, Kenneth Williams, Sid James, Kenneth Connor, Jim Dale, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims.(n)

programme.title: Terminal Velocity
programme.desc: A skydiving instructor tries to clear himself of responsibility for the death of a woman whose parachute failed to open. However, he later learns she is a Russian spy who faked her own demise, and now needs his help to foil an international criminal conspiracy out to steal a fortune in bullion. Action thriller, starring Charlie Sheen, Nastassja Kinski and James Gandolfini.(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
programme.desc: Peaceful vampire Edward marries his human girlfriend Bella, who is soon pregnant. However, the existence of this child has dangerous implications for them and the people around them, and a pack of werewolves is determined to prevent the birth by any means necessary. The first half of the two-part conclusion to the romantic fantasy series, with Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson.(n)

programme.title: Van Helsing
programme.desc: A vampire slayer heads for Transylvania to help a gypsy princess destroy evil bloodsucker Count Dracula and bring his reign of terror to an end. But he must first do battle with a werewolf, Frankenstein's monster and the count's trio of sharp-toothed brides. Gothic action adventure, starring Hugh Jackman, Kate Beckinsale, Richard Roxburgh and David Wenham.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Na Garten creates a two-course dinner in under an hour.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Na Garten demonstrates how to prepare food in a hurry, and has a picnic in her back garden.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten makes a dinner from store-cupboard ingredients and freezer standbys.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten gives comfort classics a makeover, including bagels with smoked salmon and whitefish salad.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares a variety of drop cookies and cookie-inspired desserts which are popular with children and adults.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares a classic Blue Ribbon apple pie, and shares her recipe for a double crust pie dough.(n)

programme.title: Ace of Cakes
programme.sub-title: A Four Letter Word for Pastry.
programme.desc: The team in Baltimore, Maryland, work on a crossword cake and bake a special United Services Organisation creation.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummonds celebrate the completion of their new office with a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, plus spicy Italian meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and sweet brownie pops.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares brunch for three generations of Drummond girls, including maple oat nut scones, a cowgirl quiche, and champagne oranges.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Over an evening walk, Ree Drummond plans some fast and healthy meals, including a houmous wrap, ginger steak salad, a grilled nectarine salad and a spicy cauliflower stir-fry.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares four soups, starting with hamburger soup, before making tomato soup, one-pot wonder sausage, potato and kale soup, and spinach soup.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their dietary challenge by reinventing favourite family meals. They prepare a cooked breakfast that delivers all the excitement of a fry-up without adding to the waistline, and a calorie-conscious roast chicken dinner. They also rework French classic the cassoulet and set it before a couple of famished rugby teams, and make the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to help shift the pounds - give up their beloved motorbikes in favour of bicycles.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang introduces two surveyors to a variety of new flavours, taking them to London's Chinatown to browse the spice markets. She also demonstrates how to prepare red-cooked fish, crispy Mongolian lamb and Cantonese-style duck with pak choi and rice.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang takes two taxi drivers to London's Chinatown, where she demonstrates the wide variety of chilli-based products available on the market. She then teaches them how to cook tiger prawns with shiitake mushrooms and rice wine, and a Chinese take on fish and chips.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their dietary challenge by reinventing favourite family meals. They prepare a cooked breakfast that delivers all the excitement of a fry-up without adding to the waistline, and a calorie-conscious roast chicken dinner. They also rework French classic the cassoulet and set it before a couple of famished rugby teams, and make the ultimate sacrifice in a bid to help shift the pounds - give up their beloved motorbikes in favour of bicycles.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes a breakfast burrito kit, pasta alla Ladd, chipotle ranch dressing for raw veggies, and cookies and cream cups for her daughters, who are going on a college tour.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her best friend are throwing a poolside girls' get-together. Hyacinth's hosting and Ree's taking on all the cookout favourites, but making them inside.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Ching-He Huang meets two estate agents from Bridlington. East Yorkshire, taking them to visit London's Chinatown to search for the oriental store-cupboard staples groundnut oil and sesame oil. She then teaches them how to prepare Sichuan-style sweet-and-sour prawns and three-cup chicken, before challenging them to repeat her recipes.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: Eight American bakers take part in the pre-heat challenge and create 'berry naked cakes'.(n)

programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a craft-cooking family restaurant in Portland where he joins a chef who butchers, cures, preserves and smokes everything in-house.(n)

programme.desc: The owner of Beets Cafe, Austin, Texas, asks the team for help when she fears that her employees are selling the secret recipes to her raw food menu.(n)

programme.desc: A pair of professional ice-skaters investigate hot varieties of store cupboard spices at London's Chinatown, before Ching-He Huang teaches them how to prepare peppercorn chicken, prawn-fried rice and crispy scallops.(n)

programme.desc: Two rugby players ask Ching-He Huang to help them learn to prepare oriental dishes. programme.desc: The seven remaining bakers take on outdoor activities with a ballpark snack dessert and barbeque dessert.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create low-calorie versions of their favourite party treats, including fairy cakes, quiche and chilli tacos, and Olly Smith offers advice on wines suitable for slimmers. The duo then reflect on how trying to lose weight has improved their lives and learn whether the Big Dieters have also managed to change their eating habits - before paying a final visit to diabetes expert Roy Taylor and dietician Ashley Adamson to discover if their new diets have yielded the desired results.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene allows Boycie to buy a maximum of six cows for the farm - and is less than impressed when Elgin, Jed and Bryan turn up with a herd of 300. The vet is called out when Rocky the bull fails to take any notice of the females, and Tyler prepares to sit a local private school's entrance exam. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Leonard hopes to spend his 45th birthday with Ria, but has trouble getting in touch with her, while Ben is encouraged to be more romantic and spontaneous. Comedy by Carla Lane, starring Wendy Craig and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: In the middle of a domestic economy drive, Timothy's bank account comes under scrutiny. comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean's sister-in-law Penny becomes convinced her husband is having an affair with his dental nurse and insists she move in with Jean and Lionel. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Joe Saugus throws the lads a monetary lifeline, offering to buy the transporter bridge on behalf of his people, while Barry has a final showdown with Kadi and Tatiana. Believing their financial worries are finally over, the lads set off to oversee the construction process in Arizona - where a hostile reception awaits them. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Bill Nighy star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Howard finds incriminating evidence on his person and unwittingly turns to Clegg for help.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: As Compo's attempts to reach Nora Batty's washing line fail again, he enlists Foggy's help.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: By the Magnificent Thighs of Ernie Burniston.
programme.desc: Compo is having difficulty coming to terms with being less agile and becomes jealous of local athlete Ernie Burniston when he spots him riding a bike. Meanwhile, Howard tries to deliver a birthday card to Marina without Pearl finding out. Bill Owen and Robert Fyfe star in the long-running rural comedy.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean's sister-in-law Penny becomes convinced her husband is having an affair with his dental nurse and insists she move in with Jean and Lionel. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Joe Saugus throws the lads a monetary lifeline, offering to buy the transporter bridge on behalf of his people, while Barry has a final showdown with Kadi and Tatiana. Believing their financial worries are finally over, the lads set off to oversee the construction process in Arizona - where a hostile reception awaits them. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Bill Nighy star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Errol Flynn Used to Have a Pair Like That.
programme.desc: Compo overhears Nora Batty discussing the effect Errol Flynn's riding outfit used to have on her, so he sets out to become the man of her dreams. Bill Owen stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio prepare to attend a friend's funeral, and Foggy decides they should all smarten up for the occasion. However, Compo's Maurice Chevalier outfit is not what he had in mind.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wesley adapts a ride-on lawnmower for the purpose of cleaning windows. Nora Batty pays a visit to someone unknown, so an uneasy Compo enlists the aid of Wesley's invention to declare his love for her. Bill Owen and Kathy Staff star.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Henry IX
programme.desc: Comedy starring Charles Edwards as a king who has a crisis of confidence and tries to modernise the monarchy - despite the objections of his family. With Sally Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Comedy featuring a British Pakistani family, set in Sparkhill, Birmingham. Plans for daughter Shazia's forthcoming wedding to Amjad are thrown into disarray when Mr Khan forgets to book a venue, much to his wife's displeasure. The self-opinionated patriarch isn't too concerned though, he's confident that he can persuade mosque manager Dave to do him a favour - but his long-suffering nearest and dearest know from experience that nothing is ever straightforward when father's involved. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia star, with Kris Marshall and Abdullah Afzal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan's mother comes to stay, jeopardising Mr Khan's big opportunity to hob-nob with the bigwigs of Sparkhill Business Association when he has to take the old woman on a shopping trip. Comedy about the trials and tribulations of a British Pakistani family, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: The Browns await the fruits of their fraud after faking Grandad's death to get a payout, but the insurance company starts to grow suspicious. Agnes struggles to keep him out of sight, as she has promised the money to Dermot and Maria, who are desperate to get a place of their own.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Tim are excited to discover a lesbian couple living in their building and invite them over to dinner. However, the immature friends are unprepared for the effect one of the women has on Lucy. Sitcom, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Tim Vine.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The friends plan a surprise party for Lucy's 30th birthday, but find they have different ideas about what makes a fun night. Tim wants to play charades with his sister, while Lee desires an evening of her undivided attention. However, when the guest of honour arrives, she is arm-in-arm with another man. Comedy, guest starring Timothy West, with Lee Mack, Tim Vine and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dubious transvestite Emily hits the town with her friend Florence to celebrate her last night as a single `laydee'. Dudley is unimpressed by the arrival of Ting Tong's mother, and Sid Pegg calls an urgent Neighbourhood Watch meeting when he learns a rogue caravan has moved into the area. Comedy sketches, starring Matt Lucas and David Walliams.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark makes a new friend at the office who seems likely to broaden his horizons. Meanwhile, Jeremy meets an acquaintance from school who wants him to star in his art-house movie. David Mitchell, Robert Webb and Olivia Colman star.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Tim are excited to discover a lesbian couple living in their building and invite them over to dinner. However, the immature friends are unprepared for the effect one of the women has on Lucy. Sitcom, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Tim Vine.(n)

Comedy, guest starring Timothy West, with Lee Mack, Tim Vine and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Comedy quiz show hosted by Reeves and Mortimer, with celebrity guests Robbie Coltrane, David Hamilton, Sue Cook and Denise Van Outen.(n)

programme.title: Shooting Stars
programme.desc: Adam Ant, Fern Britton, Melinda Messenger and Wayne Hemingway join team captains Mark Lamarr and Ulrika Jonsson for another round of the celebrity quiz. Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer host.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Vic and Bob highlight the dangers of spilling muesli, and look at specialist magazines SideParting Weekly and CentreParting Monthly.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie struggles to come to terms with the news that his prize bull is gay, and Marlene finds she is missing the noise of the city after suffering sleepless nights. Tyler is delighted to learn he has failed all but two of his GCSEs, thinking he will no longer be accepted at a private school - but his parents have other ideas. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.(n)

programme.title: Butterflies
programme.desc: Ria struggles to ignore Leonard, and a piece of artwork turns out to be significant for the whole family.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy throws a party while his parents are attending the Chartered Accountants' Ball. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A Hollywood producer arrives in town, full of big ideas about filming one of Lionel's books - but his plan to use authentic locations is met with disapproval. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads
programme.desc: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars.(n)

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads move into a grim little hut on the Chocanaw reservation and set about rebuilding the bridge, but Barry begins to go off the rails as he remembers the good times with Tatiana. Work goes well thanks to help from Joe's son Chip - but Granger is livid to discover he has been made a fool of, and vows to have his revenge. Tim Healy and Jimmy Nail star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Errol Flynn Used to Have a Pair Like That.
programme.desc: Compo overhears Nora Batty discussing the effect Errol Flynn's riding outfit used to have on her, so he sets out to become the man of her dreams. Bill Owen stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio prepare to attend a friend's funeral, and Foggy decides they should all smarten up for the occasion. However, Compo's Maurice Chevalier outfit is not what he had in mind.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wesley adapts a ride-on lawnmower for the purpose of cleaning windows. Nora Batty pays a visit to someone unknown, so an uneasy Compo enlists the aid of Wesley's invention to declare his love for her. Bill Owen and Kathy Staff star.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Suspicious about the validity of Foggy's war stories, Compo and Clegg use an old school challenge to establish the truth. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Marina wants to deliver a giant cuddly panda as her birthday present to lover Howard, so ropes in the reluctant trio to help. Comedy, featuring a guest appearance by comedian Jim Bowen and starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Desperate to earn some cash, Compo reveals a musical talent after being endorsed by several artists in the area and sets out as a one-man band. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, Brian Wilde and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.(n)

John Challis and Sue Holderness star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: After a taste of the high life, Del-Boy and Rodney are back in Nelson Mandela House and back in business as Trotters Independent Traders. When they receive an invitation to a cross-Channel Navy reunion intended for dear-departed Uncle Albert, Del spies the opportunity to make a few quid on a booze cruise. The only problem is, Rodney is now the company's managing director and would never approve. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, John Challis and Tessa Peake-Jones star in the 2002 Christmas special.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: The Browns await the fruits of their fraud after faking Grandad's death to get a payout, but the insurance company starts to grow suspicious. Agnes struggles to keep him out of sight, as she has promised the money to Dermot and Maria, who are desperate to get a place of their own.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Desperate duo Richie and Eddie try to improve their sex lives by using a spray apparently able to make them attractive to the opposite sex. Starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie and Eddie await their fate when the gas man discovers they are stealing their neighbour's fuel supply. Brian Glover guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Vince's dreams of musical stardom come true when Johnny Two Hats and the Electro Girls ask him to join their new band Kraftwork Orange, leading to a parting of the ways with all that is familiar - including Howard. Comedy, with Noel Fielding and Julian Barratt.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Bob Fossil arranges for Ivan the bear to be taken to an Animal Offenders Institute after he exposes himself to the visitors - but Howard and Vince will have their work cut out getting him there in one piece without falling foul of the Hitcher.(n)

programme.title: Feherty
programme.sub-title: Phil Mickelson - Masters and Ryder Cup
programme.desc: Phil Mickelson - Masters and Ryder Cup. Part 1 of 2. David Feherty sits down with Hall of Famer Phil Mickelson. Topics include Phil's three Masters victories, his rivalry with Tiger Woods, competing in 11 straight Ryder Cups, trash-talking, and his wife Amy's battle with breast cancer(n)

programme.title: Feherty
programme.sub-title: Phil Mickelson - Hall of Fame Career
programme.desc: Phil Mickelson - Hall of Fame Career. Conclusion. A chat with Phil Mickelson to discuss his Hall of Fame career. Topics include Phil's pursuit of the career grand slam, his victories in the 2013 Open and the 2005 PGA Championship, as well as his relationship with caddie Jim "Bones" McKay and his commitment to his three children(n)

programme.title: Tin Cup
programme.desc: Kevin Costner and Rene Russo light up the greens in this engaging romantic comedy. Pro golfer Roy "Tin Cup" McAvoy (Costner) falls for golf student Dr. Molly Griswold (Russo). To prove his love, he vows to win the U.S. Open, where David Simms---his lifelong rival and Molly's boyfriend---is competing. Cheech Marin, Don Johnson, Linda Hart(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance
programme.desc: The tale of a war veteran who rediscovers his talent for golf with the help of a mystical caddie. programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Rome Edition with Tonda, Flavio al Velavevodetto, La Gatta Mangiona.
programme.desc: John Catucci leaves Canada to sample comfort food from Italy, in the first of two special editions. This time, he visits Rome, and samples the menus at three must-eat restaurants.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Florence Edition with All'Antico Vinaio, Trattoria 4 Leoni, Trattoria Mario.
programme.desc: John Catuccis's Italian double bill continues as he heads to Florence, where he samples All'Antico Vinaio's in-demand panini, and Tuscan truffles at Trattoria 4 Leoni.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The competitors reach the penultimate round of the contest, heading to the Cornish village of Mousehole to test their pastry-making skills. They are challenged to produce their own versions of hearty British classics, while Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins examine the history of pies, detailing their slightly more sinister past.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The last two semi-finalists work a shift under chef Sat Bains at his two Michelin-starred restaurant in Nottingham, before recreating one of the establishment's signature dishes of pickled and sauteed mushrooms and braised oxtail with watercress panna cotta and chive beurre noisette. They then face a third test in which they must use what they have learnt from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers reflect on the 1960s, a decade of music, fashion and food trends that are still around today. They prepare steak Diane and profiteroles, meet a restaurateur who made eating out trendy and look back on a time when the motorway cafe was the height of sophisticated dining for some.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker reveals the secrets to making classic European varieties of bread. Paul starts with France by demonstrating how to make a baguette that fits into a home oven and then transforms it into roasted garlic bread. He then explores Italian cuisine, baking a crusty ciabatta for a panzanella salad and crunchy biscotti snacks, before showing how to toss the perfect pizza base without it sticking to the ceiling.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: The chef's culinary journey to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes in America continues in Baltimore, where he samples a Pimlico cake, before tasting a variety made for only six weeks of the year in rural Maryland.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip brings him to northern Greece where he enjoys traditional dishes including veal stiffado and kotopita - which Rick declares to be the best chicken pie he has ever tasted. In the coastal city of Preveza he goes out prawn fishing and follows in the footsteps of poet Lord Byron visiting Messolonghi, a city where seafood is a highly regarded commodity. Rick also rolls up his own sleeves to cook his favourite Greek dishes of stuffed peppers and tomatoes and souvlaki.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Melt Bar & Grilled, Mamo Burger, Ernie's Coffee Shop.
programme.desc: John Catucci tackles extreme grilled cheese at Cleveland's Melt Bar & Grilled, then heads to Windsor, Ontario for hand-crafted burgers at MamO Burger Bar.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Yellowbelly Brewery, Fat Bob's Smokehouse, 850 Degrees Pizzeria.
programme.desc: John Catucci samples east coast hospitality at the Yellowbellly Burger in St. John's, and in Buffalo, barbecue is the order of the day at Fat Bob's Smokehouse.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The three remaining contestants head for Fulham Palace in London for the grand final, where they are challenged to use all their skills to recreate the 19th-century tea parties once hosted in the area. Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood are joined by former competitors to pass judgement on the items offered, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present the victor with the Bake Off trophy.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining chefs are asked to prove their creativity, as judges Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti push them to the limits of their ability. The contestants have to prepare two dishes from left-overs including meat bones, chicken carcasses, fish trimmings, vegetable peelings, stale croissants and bread, and over-ripe fruit, with the judges sending one more chef home at the end.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Down Under
programme.sub-title: Australia - New South Wales North Coast.
programme.desc: Adam Liaw takes a tour of the north coast of New South Wales, and discovers spectacular surroundings and a tight-knit food community producing lemon myrtle and mulloway.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers focus on British sheep, which have provided the nation with milk, meat and wool for thousands of years. They rustle up a hogget and barley stew, lamb chops with kidneys, and North African dish mechoui lamb, and explore the history of the hardy breed found on North Ronaldsay in the Orkney Islands.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker reveals how to make sourdough, harnessing natural, airborne yeasts to leaven and give amazing flavour. He starts by baking a classic recipe in a traditional banneton basket, which gives the crust its characteristic ring pattern, and from this base he makes a white chocolate and raspberry variety and a tuna salad Nicoise with tapenade and a leaf-shaped sourdough fougasse stuffed with olives.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: James's road trip to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes in America continues in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, where he samples shoofly pie and learns how to twist pretzels.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his 900-mile road trip from Venice to Istanbul, sampling that array of gastronomic delights that lie on the route. In the penultimate episode Rick arrives in the Greek Peloponnese where he samples mouth-watering dishes such as rooster stew hilopites with mizithra cheese, and a home-made moussaka he claims is the best he have ever savoured. In his Symi island kitchen, Rick rolls up his sleeves to prepare galaktoboureko, a dessert of semolina custard in filo pastry, a favourite dish in Greece.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: James's road trip to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes in America continues in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, where he samples shoofly pie and learns how to twist pretzels.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his 900-mile road trip from Venice to Istanbul, sampling that array of gastronomic delights that lie on the route. In the penultimate episode Rick arrives in the Greek Peloponnese where he samples mouth-watering dishes such as rooster stew hilopites with mizithra cheese, and a home-made moussaka he claims is the best he have ever savoured. In his Symi island kitchen, Rick rolls up his sleeves to prepare galaktoboureko, a dessert of semolina custard in filo pastry, a favourite dish in Greece.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The three remaining contestants head for Fulham Palace in London for the grand final, where they are challenged to use all their skills to recreate the 19th-century tea parties once hosted in the area. Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood are joined by former competitors to pass judgement on the items offered, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present the victor with the Bake Off trophy.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining chefs are asked to prove their creativity, as judges Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti push them to the limits of their ability. The contestants have to prepare two dishes from left-overs including meat bones, chicken carcasses, fish trimmings, vegetable peelings, stale croissants and bread, and over-ripe fruit, with the judges sending one more chef home at the end.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers focus on British sheep, which have provided the nation with milk, meat and wool for thousands of years. African-American Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's colour barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit My Big Fat Greek Wedding, Toula (Nia Vardalos) finds her extended family rocked by the revelation that her mother and father were never really married -- which, of course, requires an even bigger Greek wedding so they can officially tie the knot. Meanwhile, Toula struggles to spice up her marriage to Ian (John Corbett), and is heartbroken when her daughter Paris (Elena Kampouris) says she wants to go to a distant college in order to get away from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: An American Haunting
programme.desc: Donald Sutherland and Sissy Spacek star in this chilling ghost story based on the documented case of a family in early 19th-century rural Tennessee that is haunted by an evil spirit. James D'Arcy, Rachel Hurd-Wood. Directed by Courtney Solomon(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'
programme.desc: A look at "The Zookeeper's Wife," a 2017 drama based on Diane Ackerman's nonfiction book about a couple who used the Warsaw Zoo to save hundreds of Jews during the German occupation of Poland during World War II. The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy about a video store employee and his hapless friend, who, after managing to wipe the films in the shop, must remake all the movies themselves. After being threatened with copyright violation by industry bigwigs, the duo are aided by the store's loyal customers in a bid to make a legitimate and original film about a local hero(n)

programme.title: Abortion: Stories Women Tell
programme.desc: Director Tracy Droz Tragos examines the debate over abortion rights in her home state of Missouri by telling the personal stories of numerous womens' experiences in this documentary. Missouri has become a state with some of the most restrictive abortion legislation, with laws requiring mandatory counseling and waiting periods before access to the procedure(n)

programme.title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
programme.desc: The 2008 sequel to the female buddy film The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants constitutes an adaptation of Ann Brashares' novel Forever in Blue: The Fourth Summer of the Sisterhood. Like the premier installment, this picture explores the seriocomic events that unfold one summer in the lives of four temporarily estranged friends as an extremely special pair of jeans works its way from one girl to the next. In one subplot, Lena (Alexis Bledel) travels to Providence, RI, and enrolls in a painting course; in another, Bridget (Blake Lively) embarks on an archaeological excavation in Greece; in a third, Carmen (America Ferrera) works on the backstage crew for a Vermont-based theater festival; and in the fourth, Tibby remains in New York and enrolls in summer courses. Sanaa Hamri, best known for her Prince and Mariah Carey music videos, directs; Elizabeth Chandler, who co-scripted the first film, adapts the Brashares book(n)

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: 8
programme.desc: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael performs in New York City at Masonic Hall. Topics include Donald Trump's victory; climate change; supporting the troops; animal rights; being a good boyfriend; and his top four fears(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two mild-mannered cousins search for a beloved pet kitten after the feline is taken during a home burglary. However, they get in over their heads when their quest leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang by posing as drug dealers(n)

programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Roaches. A roach town is in crisis after a visit by an exterminator, so the survivors band together to save their species; a group of seagulls struggles to live as one when they're stuck together by a piece of litter(n)

programme.desc: After winning the Bridgeport Regional, the undefeated UConn Huskies (36-0) head to their 10th straight Final Four in pursuit of their fifth-consecutive national championship in Dallas(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.desc: Political strategist Roger Stone and journalist Jose Antonio Vargas are the interview guests. The panelists are former CIA director Michael Hayden, former senator Rick Santorum and Center for American Progress president Neera Tanden(n)

African-American Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's colour barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: An ambitious corporate troubleshooter is stranded on a deserted island for five years, eventually returning to society as a changed man(n)

programme.title: 2 Days: Vasyl Lomachenko
programme.desc: A 48-hour visit with junior-lightweight boxer Vasyl Lomachenko(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit My Big Fat Greek Wedding, Toula (Nia Vardalos) finds her extended family rocked by the revelation that her mother and father were never really married -- which, of course, requires an even bigger Greek wedding so they can officially tie the knot. Meanwhile, Toula struggles to spice up her marriage to Ian (John Corbett), and is heartbroken when her daughter Paris (Elena Kampouris) says she wants to go to a distant college in order to get away from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: An American Haunting
programme.desc: Donald Sutherland and Sissy Spacek star in this chilling ghost story based on the documented case of a family in early 19th-century rural Tennessee that is haunted by an evil spirit. James D'Arcy, Rachel Hurd-Wood. Directed by Courtney Solomon(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'
programme.desc: A look at "The Zookeeper's Wife," a 2017 drama based on Diane Ackerman's nonfiction book about a couple who used the Warsaw Zoo to save hundreds of Jews during the German occupation of Poland during World War II. The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy about a video store employee and his hapless friend, who, after managing to wipe the films in the shop, must remake all the movies themselves. After being threatened with copyright violation by industry bigwigs, the duo are aided by the store's loyal customers in a bid to make a legitimate and original film about a local hero(n)

programme.title: Abortion: Stories Women Tell
programme.desc: Director Tracy Droz Tragos examines the debate over abortion rights in her home state of Missouri by telling the personal stories of numerous womens' experiences in this documentary. Missouri has become a state with some of the most restrictive abortion legislation, with laws requiring mandatory counseling and waiting periods before access to the procedure(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: A girl suffers through a forgotten 16th birthday, dealing with unrequited love and the unwanted attention of a nerd in this teen classic(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 110. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Gifted'

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Young parents Mac and Kelly find that their neighbor troubles are far from over when a hedonistic sorority moves in next door in this hysterical comedy sequel. During their feud with the ladies, the couple team up with ex-fratboy Teddy, who tormented them the last time around(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: After winning the Bridgeport Regional, the undefeated UConn Huskies (36-0) head to their 10th straight Final Four in pursuit of their fifth-consecutive national championship in Dallas(n)

programme.title: Cries from Syria
programme.desc: An examination of the Syrian civil war, as recounted by activists, protesters and even former members of the military who have risked their lives to fight against a 40-year dictatorship(n)

programme.title: Cape Fear
programme.desc: A sadistic psychopath, released from prison after serving a 14-year sentence, is obsessed with taking his revenge on the lawyer who unsuccessfully defended him. Too clever to attack his victim directly, the devious ex-con begins a reign of terror that threatens the lawyer's whole family and causes underlying tensions to explode with devastating results(n)

programme.title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
programme.desc: The 2008 sequel to the female buddy film The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants constitutes an adaptation of Ann Brashares' novel Forever in Blue: The Fourth Summer of the Sisterhood. Like the premier installment, this picture explores the seriocomic events that unfold one summer in the lives of four temporarily estranged friends as an extremely special pair of jeans works its way from one girl to the next. In one subplot, Lena (Alexis Bledel) travels to Providence, RI, and enrolls in a painting course; in another, Bridget (Blake Lively) embarks on an archaeological excavation in Greece; in a third, Carmen (America Ferrera) works on the backstage crew for a Vermont-based theater festival; and in the fourth, Tibby remains in New York and enrolls in summer courses. Sanaa Hamri, best known for her Prince and Mariah Carey music videos, directs; Elizabeth Chandler, who co-scripted the first film, adapts the Brashares book(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Big-screen animated adventures of the cartoon characters from the TV series. Homer triggers an environmental calamity in Springfield that has far-reaching effects for the town and the planet(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: During the Seattle grunge era, twentysomethings living in the same apartment complex come to terms with real life in the grown-up world(n)

programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a newly engaged couple who must take an outlandish marriage-preparation course from a creepy clergyman(n)

programme.desc: Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg). Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.desc: Life Under Sharia & Plastic Oceans. programme.desc: Two siblings uncover a harrowing secret about their grandparents while spending a week at their remote Pennsylvania farm(n)

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: (1999) M Night Shyamalan's chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a past case he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists... Also starring Toni Collette. M,W,S,(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Damon Wayans and Adam Sandler star in Bulletproof an action comedy from Universal Pictures. The story of a cop, a crook, and a beautiful friendship gone sour takes place in a world where loyalty goes to the highest bidder and the only one you can trust turns out to be your worst enemy. Once partners in crime, Archie Moses and Rock Keats are now on opposite sides of the law. Each feels betrayed by the other, but as fate would have it they're back together and on the run(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Sisters'
programme.desc: A look at "Sisters," a 2015 comedy about two siblings who throw one last party at their childhood home before their parents sell it. The film stars Tina Fey, Amy Poehler and Ike Barinholtz, and is directed by Jason Moore(n)

programme.title: Immigration Tango
programme.desc: Love crosses international boundaries and makes a big mess en route in this romantic comedy. Carlos Sanchez (Carlos Leon) is from Latin America, and Elena Dubrovnik (Elika Portnoy) is from Russia. Carlos and Elena are in love and living in the United States, but while they'd like to stay, they have a problem -- their visas are soon to expire, and they aren't sure when or if they'll be able to get green cards that will allow them permanent residence. Carlos and Elena are close friends with Mike White (McCaleb Burnett) and Betty Bristol (Ashley Wolfe), who were born and raised in the States. Like Carlos and Elena, Mike and Betty are planning to marry but haven't done so yet, and when they learn of their friends' dilemma, someone comes up with a solution -- Carlos will marry Betty, Mike will marry Elena, and once their respective green cards come through, both couples will divorce and everyone lives happily ever after. However, the plan doesn't go as smoothly as expected -- suspicious immigration agents are keeping a close watch on Carlos and Elena, so the newlyweds have to live with their respective spouses and act happily married in order to maintain the illusion of matrimony, which leads the four friends into a variety of romantic complications. Immigration Tango received its world premiere at the 2010 Boston International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: Alex Hesse and Larry Arbogast are working on a new drug which will reduce the chances of a woman's body rejecting an embryo and thus causing a miscarriage. When their research funding is withdrawn, and human experimentation is denied to them, they decide to test the drug by breifly impregnating Hesse. Hesse however becomes attached to "his" unborn baby(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: Sydney White
programme.desc: Modern American retelling of the fairytale Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. Sydney White goes away to college and enrols in the same sorority house her mother used to be in, only to find that girls these days aren't as nice as her mother. Moving in with seven social outcasts in the run-down frat house next door, she takes on the system and tries to show the cool kids how selfish their hierarchy has become(n)

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: Just how low will a guy sink in order to impress the woman of his dreams? How does stealing her dog sound? In Lost and Found, David Spade plays Dylan, who is about to open an new restaurant and has finally found the perfect apartment. The apartment just gets better when he meets his new neighbor, Lila (Sophie Marceau), a very beautiful women who has recently come to the United States from France. However, Lila has just gotten out of a bad relationship with René (Patrick Bruel), who doesn't want to leave her alone, so she has little interest in romance, preferring to devote herself to her cello and her dog Jack. One day, Jack runs away and Dylan finds him; when he returns the pooch to Lila, it's the first time she's been willing to speak in full sentences to him, though not for very long. Faster than you can say "That idea is so crazy it just might work!", Dylan decides to kidnap Jack; when Lila thinks the dog is lost, Dylan will generously volunteer to help look for him, which will give Dylan a chance to impress Lila when he's able to find Jack so quickly. Sure enough, Dylan swipes the dog, but from that point on the plan hardly goes the way he had hoped. Star David Spade also co-wrote the screenplay with J.B. Cook and Marc Meeks; the supporting cast includes Martin Sheen, Mitchell Whitfield, Artie Lang and Jon Lovitz(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: A teenager turns his house into a brothel while his parents are away in this sharp comedy highlighted by Cruise's star-making performance(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Classic cult comedy following the adventures of a superannuated Los Angeles hippie who is mistaken for a wealthy industrialist and soon becomes involved in an outlandish extortion scheme. Enjoying a sedentary life of bowling and Bob Dylan the eponymous hero finds himself surrounded by nihilists, henchmen and performance artists when he is paid to deliver the ransom for the kidnapped wife of a conservative businessman, also called Lebowski(n)

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Let the treasure hunt begin! Matthew McConaughey, Kate Hudson and Donald Sutherland star in this romantic comedy caper about an estranged couple whose romance and sense of adventure is rekindled when they discover a clue to a long-lost treasure. Divorced and in debt, the ex-lovers re-team in their search for a lost treasure-laden Spanish galleon, enlisting the aid of a multimillionaire and his celebutante daughter. But hard are their heels are a former partner and a ruthless drug dealer who will stop at nothing to be the first to find the fortune in a no-holds-barred hunt for Fool's Gold(n)

programme.desc: Jason Schwartzman stars in this quirky comedy as an ambitious prep-school student. While he flirts with expulsion, he also cultivates a romantic fixation on a teacher, and befriends a local steel magnate (Bill Murray) who encourages the teen's dreams. Olivia Williams, Seymour Cassel, Brian Cox, Mason Gamble(n)

programme.title: Richard Jeni: A Big Steaming Pile of Me
programme.desc: Comedy special from US stand-up Richard Jeni, who riffs on a host of subjects including Americans' obsession with weight, drug abuse, pornography, and the legal problems faced by Martha Stewart(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The original cast members of the critically acclaimed series reunite. During its illustrious run M*A*S*H garnered 14 Emmy Awards among numerous other accolades(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Yuppie Daniel Miller is killed in a car accident and goes to Judgement City, a waiting room for the after life. During the day, he must prove in courtroom-style process that he led a successful life(n)

programme.title: Haiku Tunnel
programme.desc: A temp worker is promoted to permanent status and finds his whole world changing as a result in this satiric comedy. Josh (Josh Kornbluth) is an overstuffed aspiring writer who is trying to finish his first novel, but in the meantime he supports himself by working as an office temp. Josh has grown accustomed to the Byzantine world of temporary labor, particularly the bossy secretaries and chilly co-workers, but Josh manages to impress his latest employers enough that they offer to make him a permanent, full-time employee. While a fellow temp who worked for the same company warns Josh that taking the job would be a mistake, Josh takes the plunge anyway, and soon discovers that his fellow employees now embrace him as one of their own. He also discovers that Bob Shelby (Warren Keith), his new boss, is more than a little crazy, and when Bob gives Josh an assignment to mail a series of important letters, John finds that he's suddenly incapable of doing this seemingly simple task. Instead, Josh spends his days working on his book (on company time and on a company computer), with his fellow office drones offering emphatic encouragement. Josh Kornbluth adapted Haiku Tunnel (with the help of John Bellucci and Jacob Kornbluth) from a semi-improvised one-man show Kornbluth created with David Ford; the Kornbluth brothers also directed the film(n)

programme.title: Down Periscope
programme.desc: As punishment for a near-miss with a Soviet vessel, a maverick skipper is given a leaky sub to drive. The admiral is worried about old hulks being commandeered by terrorists, so Captain Dodge has to test whether this one can still float. Comedy(n)

Fearing that they will be sent back to the forest if the relationship becomes too serious, the three decide to head to Florida to stop the proposal. Luckily, Miles isn't thrilled with the idea of having a stepfather, so he decides to accompany them on their zany road trip. Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler, and Jesse McCartney provide the voices of the chipmunks. Bella Thorne and Tony Hale co-star. Directed by Walt Becker(n)

When an evil alien attacks the Earth, this motley crew of monsters is called into action to save the world from imminent destruction(n)

programme.title: The Last Mimzy
programme.desc: An intergalactic package discovered on the beach holds a myriad of fantastic discoveries for siblings Noah and Emma Wilder in The Last Mimzy, studio head-turned-director Bob Shaye's wondrous sci-fi fantasy parable. The children stumble onto their discovery amid a trip to the family beach house, and find inside of the crate strange crystals that Emma levitates with her mind, as well as the Mimzy -- a stuffed bunny with a built-in supercomputer that advances its possessor's brain by great leaps and bounds by whispering into the person's ear. Meanwhile, via interaction with the box and its contents, Noah gains the ability to converse with spiders and instructs them to build miniature bridges. He also etches complex Tibetan mandalas, and somehow manages to black out half of Seattle. The children naturally keep these happenings (and the box) from their mom and dad (Joely Richardson and Timothy Hutton), but in time the kids set their sights higher and embark on correcting huge problems that cannot be missed. Rainn Wilson (The Office) co-stars as the children's hippie science teacher; New Age expert Bruce Joel Rubin (Ghost, Jacob's Ladder) and Toby Emmerich co-authored the script, adapting the 1943 short story Mimsy Were the Borogoves, by Lewis Padgett(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: The delightfully hilarious gang from The Peanuts returns after 35 years for their silver screen debut. Join Charlie Brown, Lucy, Linus and friends on a new epic adventure while Snoopy tracks down his nemesis, the Red Baron. Charles M. Schulz's iconic characters are brought to life in state of the art 3D animation from Blue Sky Studios, the creators of the Ice Age films. Directed by Steve Martino. programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this captivating sci-fi adventure, Roy rescues his son Alton from a cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper, the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels and begins to alienate his lover Aline Bernstein (Nicole Kidman), Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s. Laura Linney, Guy Pearce, and Dominic West co-star in director Michael Grandage's debut feature film(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: When Princess Pei Pei is kidnapped from the Forbidden City, Wang feels personally responsible and insists on joining the guards sent to rescue the Princess, who has been whisked away to the United States. In Nevada and hot on the trail of the kidnappers, Wang is separated from the group and soon finds himself an unlikely partner with Roy O'Bannon, a small time robber with delusions of grandeur. Together, the two forge onto one misadventure after another(n)

programme.title: Out for Justice
programme.desc: In this violent actioner, Steven Seagal plays a renegade cop who returns to his violence-plagued home neighborhood in Brooklyn to get revenge upon the crime lord responsible for his partner's death(n)

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: Superhero Batman resurfaces for another Gotham City adventure, pitted against the villainous Penguin and the devious, sexually-charged Catwoman. Action(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: Still grieving for the death of his elder brother, who died in infamous cross country race The Crucible, James "Speed" Racer is a talented young driver who decides to enter the race himself. Turning down offers from powerful corrupt companies who are rigging races, he wants to win for the honour of his small family racing business. To do so he enlists the help of mysterious one-time rival Racer X, but gets a surprise when he discovers Racer X's real identity(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman (Ben Affleck) and Superman (Henry Cavill) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor (Jesse Eisenberg). Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: In this irreverent spin on the superhero genre, mercenary Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) agrees to participate in a top-secret experiment after learning that he has terminal cancer. When the procedure leaves him with advanced healing powers and a disfigured face, he reinvents himself as a wisecracking, spandex-clad antihero known as Deadpool, and seeks revenge on those responsible. Morena Baccarin, Ed Skrein, T.J. Miller, and Gina Carano co-star. Directed by Tim Miller(n)

programme.title: The Conspirator
programme.desc: Lawyer Frederick Aiken defends Mary Surratt from charges of participating in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln, and realises that she's being used as bait to capture her son, the only conspirator to have eluded justice(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: Coyote Ugly
programme.desc: This 21-year-old belle from a small town in New Jersey moves to New York City with aspirations of becoming a songwriter. But reality crashes down hard for this beautiful bumpkin, and soon she finds herself with nothing but a couple of dollars and a sack of returned demo tapes. This is where the 'coyotes' fit in as Violet, now nicknamed 'Jersey', gets a job at the hottest bar in town, Coyote Ugly. She soon finds herself behind and on top of the counter strutting her stuff with the likes of Tyra Banks and calling, as well as pouring, the shots(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: In this irreverent spin on the superhero genre, mercenary Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) agrees to participate in a top-secret experiment after learning that he has terminal cancer. Directed by Zack Snyder, Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice also co-stars Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jeremy Irons as Alfred the butler, and Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: After being discharged from the Army, Brian Flanagan (Tom Cruise) moves back to Queens and takes a job in a bar run by Doug Coughlin (Bryan Brown), who teaches Brian the fine art of bartending. Brian quickly becomes a patron favorite with his flashy drink-mixing style. Brian adopts his mentor's cynical philosophy on life and goes for the money. He leaves his artist girlfriend Jordan Mooney (Elisabeth Shue) for Bonnie (Lisa Banes), a wealthy, high-powered executive. Brian soon must chose between the two, as he evaluates his options. Scriptwriter Heywood Gould displayed his sense of humor when assigning the character name "Mr. Mooney" to Lucille Ball's real-life son-in-law, actor Laurence Luckenbill. Television fans of The Lucy Show will recall Mr. Mooney, played by Gale Gordon, as Lucy's fussy financial boss. The film is more memorable for the 17-song soundtrack and plays like a series of MTV videos. Cocktail was a big draw at the box office in 1988(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: The NFL meets Hollywood as the Rams move to Los Angeles with little time to spare in their quest to build an NFL roster and establish a new tradition in Southern California(n)

programme.title: Interview With the Vampire

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: In Shawn Levy's romantic comedy, Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy play Tom Leezak and Sarah McNerney, a chalk-and-cheese couple who fall in love and marry. Now, all they need for the union to work is to survive both families disapproval of the match, deal with the well-meaning friends who meddle too much and, on their honeymoon, suffer a selection of Europe's worst accommodation. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Assassins
programme.desc: Thriller about a top-class hit man whose retirement plans are scuppered when he is forced to confront a younger rival bent on assuming his No 1 status. Reluctantly drawn back into the world he wants to leave behind, he needs to muster all his strength and skill if he is to save his own life. From the director of the 'Lethal Weapon' series(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: Legendary director Martin Scorsese takes the helm for this tale of questionable loyalties and blurring identities set in the South Boston organized crime scene and inspired by the wildly popular 2002 Hong Kong crime film Infernal Affairs. As the police force attempts to reign in the increasingly powerful Irish mafia, authorities are faced with the prospect of sending in an undercover agent or seeing their already frail grip on the criminal underworld slip even further. Billy Costigan (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a young cop looking to make a name for himself in the world of law enforcement. Collin Sullivan (Matt Damon) is a street-smart criminal who has successfully infiltrated the police department with the sole intention of reporting their every move to ruthless syndicate head Frank Costello (Jack Nicholson). When Costigan is assigned the task of working his way into Costello's tightly guarded inner circle, Sullivan is faced with the responsibility of rooting out the informer before things get out of hand. With the stakes constantly rising and time quickly running out for the undercover cop and his criminal counterpart, each man must work feverishly to reveal his counterpart before his identity is exposed by the other. Martin Sheen, Alec Baldwin, and Ray Winstone co-star, and writer William Monahan adapts a screenplay originally penned by Alan Mak and Felix Chong(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Local boy Barry Dyson is accused of a series of arson attacks - and his clandestine relationship with a former employer's daughter complicates his plea of innocence. Peggy's latest money-making scheme with old friend Denzil creates an eyesore, forcing Jack to use his artistic flair to rectify matters, before he and Blaketon resort to more drastic - and illegal - measures. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor and Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love.
programme.desc: The discovery of a woman's body in a car park presents Jack Frost with another challenge to his deductive powers. Delving into the victim's electronic organiser, he learns she was connected with a local religious community - and realises someone in the congregation is more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and John Lyons.(n)

programme.title: Cold Blood
programme.desc: Eve takes an intense personal dislike to an arrogant Army officer and becomes convinced he is guilty of murdering a woman whose body was found during an exercise. Undeterred by minor details like a complete absence of proof, she jeopardises her career by confronting him in the presence of witnesses and blurting out her suspicions. Fortunately, Jake is on hand to help solve the case with another of his penetrating insights into the criminal mind. Former Coronation Street cast member Bill Ward (Charlie Stubbs) guests.(n)

programme.title: Doctor at Large
programme.desc: Dick applies for the position of chief house surgeon and thinks he has the job when he discovers that Paul, Michael and Bingham are on the interview board.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A disgruntled client falls under suspicion when an insurance salesman is found murdered, but the victim's complicated private life gives Mason a lot to think about before the case is solved. Alf Ventress makes himself at home in the Aidensfield Arms while his house undergoes repairs, and soon overstays his welcome, while a drunk locked up in the cells for a night turns out to be a war hero friend of Sgt Miller fallen on hard times.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias Harding makes his presence felt in Skelthwaite by ruthlessly firing Alan from the factory, while Luke is rushed to hospital after a serious accident on the rugby field, and Beth has a chance to test her maternal instincts when she is asked to lead the children's Moon Catching Expedition. Starring Brian Capron, Keith Barron, Christian Cooke and Kerrie Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: As the staff come to terms with the recent tragic events, new ambulance driver Bobby makes a dramatic entrance. Marian finds herself a partner for the gig by Alun's band - but the evening ends in chaos when a fire breaks out at the overcrowded club. Up on the moors, a shooting incident leaves Ormerod and Bobby in danger and the mountain rescue team is called out to an elderly lady lying wounded outside her decaying farmhouse. Guest starring former Coronation Street star Sean Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.title: The Royal

programme.title: Where the Heart Is

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick has to go undercover following the unlikely event of a gangster setting up shop in rural Aidensfield - and luckily his former girlfriend Jill is able to help out.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: Part two of a moody whodunit from the pen of Britain's queen of crime fiction, starring Eleanor David as bride-to-be Alice Whittaker, whose marriage plans are thrown into turmoil by the disappearance of a close friend opposed to her impending nuptials. Disregarding assurances that there is nothing to worry about, Alice sets out to investigate - and soon uncovers evidence of foul play lurking just beneath the surface of local life. With Mark Frankel, Peter Egan, Jane Gurnett and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.desc: A distraught mother asks Sir Richard to intervene on behalf of her son, who has been charged with cowardice, while the Bellamy household is disrupted by news of Edward going Awol and threats from the military police.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates a double poisoning, aiming to prove the innocence of Elinor Carlisle, the chief suspect in the deaths of her aunt and her rival in love. However, it emerges that she is the only person with a motive, opportunity and means to administer the poison. Crime drama, starring David Suchet, Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Diana Quick, Paul McGann and Rupert Penry-Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: In Whitehall, the king is angry to learn his orders to create firebreaks have been ignored by his advisers, while Sarah, still separated from Thomas, sneaks back into Hanford's house and retrieves the mysterious box from Romero's room. Later, Lord Denton reads the letters inside and realises that James, Duke of York, is the mastermind behind the plot to assassinate his brother Charles. Elizabeth confronts Pepys about his infidelity and decides to get even as she pays her dance teacher Alfredo a visit.(n)

programme.title: The Great Fire
programme.desc: When Hannah lets slip to David that his father is alive, he runs off to the Navy yards to seek the truth, closely followed by her. As Thomas and Sarah search for the children, Sarah is captured and dragged away, finding herself accused of treason. With Lord Denton doing everything in his power to convince the king of her involvement in the plot to start the fire, her only hope lies with her brother-in-law - can the baker get in touch with Samuel before it's too late? Andrew Buchan, Rose Leslie and Charles Dance star. Last in the series.(n)

Andrew stirs up resentment by ordering receptionist Dawn Rudge to give up her other job. Rural drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne, Joseph Millson and John Alderton.(n)
