Poirot, who is guest of honour at the gathering, appears to have an open-and-shut case on his hands - but the sleuth finds himself up against one of his finest adversaries. Whodunit, guest-starring Sarah Miles (Ryan's Daughter), with David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: As Syndicate 9 investigates the discovery of a woman's body in a Manchester hotel room, Gill introduces Rachel to high-flying DS Will Pemberton, unaware they are already well acquainted - they've been having a passionate, secret relationship for months. But while the volatile copper can be discreet when it comes to romance, will she be able to hide her feelings when Gill lets slip that she wasn't the first choice for the sergeant's job? Meanwhile, Janet is keen to give her own love life a boost, especially after seeing how happy Ade is with his new partner Eleanor. However, a speed-dating event might not be the best option, as Janet finds herself treating each brief encounter like a police interrogation. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Amelia Bullmore, Steve Touissant and Mina Anwar.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Unable to get used to the fact she was second choice for the sergeant's job, Rachel punishes Janet for keeping the truth from her, and although Will cheers her up with the news she has been chosen for a vice initiative, the detective is soon stung by Gill's harsh words. Meanwhile, an unconscious baby is admitted to hospital with injuries that do not match his parents' explanation of events, and when an unregistered childminder and her boyfriend enter the equation, it's unclear who had the boy's best interests at heart.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As the trial of local teenager Gary Bell approaches, Sidney and Geordie find themselves in disagreement regarding his guilt. Meanwhile, a man is convinced that his dead wife is haunting his home and stable yards, and implores Sidney to come to his estate and perform an exorcism for him. The vicar offers prayers and counsel, but when the man is found hanged in the exact same spot in which his wife died, Sidney and Geordie are united by a shared goal as they investigate his suicide. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green.(n)

programme.desc: The investigators' attentions are drawn to a woman whose house is full of neglected animals. An examination suggests some of the creatures will not survive.(n)

When one of her boots was found in woodland detectives searched the area, but no body was recovered.(n)

programme.desc: Oh, the Guilt. Dr. Bailey (Chandra Wilson) again shows her (usually well-concealed!) tender side as she counsels a young breast-cancer victim (Justina Machado) suffering from depression. Later on, Bailey receives some strong moral support as she stands before an M&M board, defending herself from charges that she was responsible for the death of Denny Duquette. Elsewhere, It is revealed that the talented Dr. Sloan (Eric Dane) has not only been dallying with Addison (Kate Walsh), but also with Callie (Sara Ramirez); Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) decides to call it quits with Finn, and later teams with Addison to separate a divorced couple (Arye Gross, Faith Prince) who have become embarrassingly "stuck on each other"; and Izzie (Katherine Heigl) is still recovering from the news that Denny has left her $8.7 million(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Where the Boys Are. The male staffers at Seattle Grace go on a camping trip in the mountains, which culminates in a "slap fight" (so to speak) between George (T.R. Knight) and Alex (Justin Chambers). Addison (Kate Walsh) and Callie (Sara Ramirez) have a lot to talk over as they team up on a medical case. Bailey (Chandra Wilson) tears into Cristina (Sandra Oh) concerning her strange actions vis-à-vis Burke (Isaiah Washington). And Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) enters unchartered territory (for her) as she assists Sloan (Eric Dane) with a very delicate "corrective" procedure (Hint: the patient is named Donna, but she used to be Daniel). This episode earned a special award from the Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Staring at the Sun. George (T.R. Knight) has trouble explaining to his somewhat thick-eared siblings that their father Harold (George Dzundza) must have heart surgery. When Burke (Isaiah Washington) is chosen to perform the operation, he wonders if he's up to it--and so, after a while, is George. Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) is profoundly affected by her young patient Mia (Brooke Bryan), who seems to prefer her allegedly abusive nanny to her mother. After calling a truce with Addison (Kate Walsh), Derek (Patrick Dempsey) shares a few words (and a bath!) with Meredith. And two other couples face an uphill climb in search of common ground(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 92/93 & 93/94. We go back to the start of the first two seasons of the Premier League and take a look at the first 78 goals scored as United recorded back-to-back league titles.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 94/95 & 95/96. Volume 2 takes us from goal 79 to goal 156, including the record 9-0 win over Ipswich and United's fastest Premier League goal, scored by Ryan Giggs.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 96/97 & 97/98. Volume 3 takes us from goal 157 to goal 236, including Eric Cantona's famous chip against Sunderland and another league title for the Reds.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 98/99 & 99/00. Volume 4 takes us from goal 237 to goal 340. The Reds recorded a historic Treble and then went goal crazy, hitting 59 to win the league in 1999/2000.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 00/01 & 01/02. Volume 5 takes us from goal 341 to goal 429, including six of the best in one memorable afternoon against Arsenal.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 02/03 & 03/04. Volume 6 takes us from goal 430 to goal 508. The Reds' faithful were treated to the finishing prowess of Ruud van Nistelrooy, who scored three hat-tricks in 02/03.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 04/05 & 05/06. Volume 7 takes us from goal 509 to goal 576, including Wayne Rooney's majestic volley against Newcastle as he announced himself as the next United superstar.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 06/07 & 07/08. Volume 8 takes us from goal 577 to goal 669, as the Reds reclaimed their Premier League crown and Cristiano Ronaldo scored goal after goal, including 21 in a season.(n)

programme.title: When Mata Met Monaghan
programme.desc: Hollywood actor Dominic Monaghan and Juan Mata take a special trip around Manchester to see their favourite places in the city.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend visit petrol-head Kim in Hampshire, the owner of an accident-damaged 1995 Nissan Skyline GT-R. The team take on the challenge of transforming her Japanese supercar into a street racer's dream.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the first night in Peterborough, 39-year-old land surveyor and part-time musician Muneer hopes to win over his guests with a menu based on Pakistani recipes passed down through his family for generations. The authenticity extends beyond his food, with Muneer seating his guests on the floor of his specially dressed dining room. His guests include driving instructor Christine, hairdresser Ben, fiery Brazilian Rosie and fridge salesman Gregory. While his food receives mixed reviews, His guests discover his master plan for musical success, suffer bad jokes and find out that one of their fellow diners believes in mermaids.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, driving instructor Christine hopes her vegetarian cuisine will grab her the £1,000 prize. But she's worried about being in the firing line, after Rosie compared Muneer's food to vomit on the first night. Now Moony's determined to give Rosie a public dressing down. However, with everyone dreading Christine's meat-free and bland-sounding menu, Rosie may not be the only one who has to bite her lip.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, mobile hairdresser Ben plans a gourmet night. Most of his guests are looking forward to some meat after Christine's vegetarian feast the night before. And after laid-back Muneer and critical Rosie seem to have put their tension behind them at Christine's, Ben's determined to take things up a notch as he entertains his guests with his amazing body art, cooking skills and pet crabs.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fridge salesman Gregory serves up a Spanish menu in Peterborough, accompanied by a charm offensive that he hopes will win him the £1,000 prize. Will it work or will the guests give him the cold shoulder?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fiery Brazilian Rosie hosts the final meal in Peterborough, but her brutally honest critiques have ruffled a few feathers throughout the week, leaving her guests in picky moods.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps couple Richard and Felicity Arcelli search for a second home in the Coimbra region of Portugal, with the pair hoping to find a renovation project within their £40,000 budget that can be transformed into a permanent residence.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Surrey couple Brenda and Nick Kennett are looking for a family holiday home in the Correze region of France, and Sara Damergi takes them to view potential properties within their budget of £60,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team embark on another excavation, searching for Liberty's first silk factory in south London. The archaeologists try to re-create the 19th-century techniques of dyeing and printing that would have been used - and the frustrating dig finally yields results on the last day.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Bath, Somerset: Death in the Crescent.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the experts visit Bath's Royal Crescent, where they go in search of a Roman cemetery and the remains of the Fosse Way. Their quest is hampered by torrential rain and an unexpected Victorian cellar, but after three days of hard digging, they still hope to come up trumps.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim, Fuzz and the team work on a 1963 Alfa Romeo Giulia Spider that has been kept in a dusty barn in Essex after its owner's plans to restore it were interrupted by the onset of a serious medical condition.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Staffordshire bull terrier puppy called Rex receives treatment for a badly deformed elbow, and the team carry out a complicated procedure to realign the bones. Meanwhile, a cross-breed called Piggy with spinal problems leaves its family facing a difficult decision, and Noel devises an unorthodox cure for a stray cat with a badly fractured leg.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The pets with problems this week include a rare breed of bulldog called Cyrus, who has multiple issues, a lame husky named Ghost, and a Maltese-bichon frise cross suffering from seizures. Plus, Bucklersbury Bear, a huge Newfoundland, finds a new lease of life post-surgery - in the water.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Bill Bailey takes his dog out in the Lake District, Sarah Parish is in the New Forest with her border terrier and Ben Fogle is in Dungeness with his Labrador.(n)

programme.title: The Good Fight
programme.desc: Diane raises eyebrows while settling in at her new firm, and Maia continues to deal with the fallout from her family's financial dealings. Christine Baranski and Rose Leslie star.(n)

programme.title: Finding My Twin Stranger
programme.desc: A documentary offering an insight into the social media-fuelled phenomenon of people seeking to find their twin stranger. In a unique experiment, seven non-related pairs agree to undergo a series of cutting-edge tests to uncover the science behind twin-like similarities in complete strangers, aiming to prove if these shared similar attributes are more than sheer coincidence.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and Henning Wehn compete against Jon Richardson and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Tom Allen joins the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters with `help' from Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partner's parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice.(n)

programme.title: The Good Fight
programme.desc: Diane raises eyebrows while settling in at her new firm, and Maia continues to deal with the fallout from her family's financial dealings. Christine Baranski and Rose Leslie star.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Bill Bailey takes his dog out in the Lake District, Sarah Parish is in the New Forest with her border terrier and Ben Fogle is in Dungeness with his Labrador.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates whether manuka honey has any medicinal properties, while Kate Quilton discovers how some varieties of caviar - a product associated with luxury and wealth - are being sold at relatively low prices. Plus, Matt Tebbutt heads to a Scottish distillery to find out what gives whisky its distinctive flavour.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim, Fuzz and the team work on a 1963 Alfa Romeo Giulia Spider that has been kept in a dusty barn in Essex after its owner's plans to restore it were interrupted by the onset of a serious medical condition.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nursing manager Sarah hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, taking inspiration from her husband's Middle Eastern heritage to offer her guests a Turkish fusion menu. Joining her is 28-year-old painter decorator Alex, 45-year-old bridal shop owner Abbi, 60-year-old community centre manager Janet and 56-year-old record label boss Phil. A hilarious evening lies in store, with unexpected tattoos, beauty tips and twerking.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Would-be clairvoyant Janet hosts the second of a week of dinner parties in Leeds and hopes her ghoul-themed dinner party will help her win the cash prize. Part of Janet's plan is to pretend her house is haunted and she has a practical joke lined up for nursing manager Sarah and bridal shop owner Abbi to find. With more surprises in store, will the fright-night theme be enough to ghost Janet into the lead?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Record label owner Phil hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, hoping to win the £1,000 prize money by serving up a 1970s rock-themed menu. His guests are astounded by his mystery past, and painter and decorator Alex is unimpressed when wedding shop owner Abbi continues to wind him up.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Painter and decorator Alex hosts the fourth night in Leeds, hoping to win the prize money by serving up a cruise-themed menu from around the world - which impresses jealous rival Janet so much, she almost turns violent. Abbi continues to belittle the host - until he reveals he spends his evenings on stage impersonating a famous heart-throb singer. Will his performance bag him the top prize?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bridal shop owner Abbi hopes to woo her guests with a wedding-themed party on the final day of the competition in Leeds. All week Abbi and Michael Buble impersonator Alex have had a bit of a banter that has sailed close to the wind. Will the tension take over, or can the wedding theme create an amorous atmosphere that will help Abbi win the £1,000 prize?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi offers more advice to people buying a second property abroad, this time helping to find the perfect holiday home to be shared by three sisters and their brother in the Poitou-Charentes region of south-western France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sama Damergi helps Paula Brown to pursue her dream of retiring to the Vendee region of western France. With a budget of £80,000, Paula hopes she will be able to buy a property in which she can keep chickens and grow vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Athelney, Somerset: Back to Our Roots.
programme.desc: In an edition first shown to mark the 100th episode of the archaeology show, Tony Robinson and the team revisit Athelney in Somerset, where King Alfred established a stronghold from which he campaigned to drive the Vikings out of England and unite the local kingdoms as a single nation. When Time Team first looked at Athelney, no digging was allowed at the site, but now excavations of the famous fortified abbey uncover a startling revelation about its origins.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Kew Gardens, London: Looking for the White House.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit the site of a forgotten palace built for George III at Kew Gardens in west London. The kitchen block is the only visible evidence that remains, so the immaculate lawns are ripped up in a search for the foundations.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Hampshire to repair a VW Golf GTI Mk1 that has been kept in a garage since a road accident in 2001. However, they both have different ideas about how the finished car should look when it is returned to its owner.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces a new challenge when he is called upon to save the life of a buzzard with a broken wing. A couple's beloved labrador turns up at the clinic with badly damaged elbow joints, and a pampered cat that is used to living the good life faces surgery to repair slipping knee-caps.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Bengal cat called Tia is rushed in to Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a car. Noel Fitzpatrick faces the painstakingly difficult task of reconstructing Tia's tiny bones using a combination of rods and pins. Whippet Wobble, a rescue dog, is so badly injured that Noel has no choice but to perform a high-risk operation, and Alfie, a labrador care-dog, arrives at the surgery in need of help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Julie and Mark Veysey, whose vision is a Miami-style beach house overlooking the south Devon coast. The design resembles a series of white interlocking boxes topped with a flat zinc roof, and a barbecue and hot tub on the veranda, as well as a cinema room, are also part of the project. However, with a budget of just £200,000, they may have a hard time realising their dreams.(n)

programme.title: The Team
programme.desc: The detectives' search for Loukauskis is narrowed down to an abandoned factory in the Belgian countryside. Jackie finds his ex-wife Dahlia dead in her garden, but the murderer turns out to be an unlikely killer. Meanwhile, Alicia and Harald arrive at the factory and are stunned by the scale of the slavery operation in evidence. At first there's no sign of Loukauskis, but this time the team is determined he must not escape. Thriller, starring Lars Mikkelsen, Jasmin Gerat and Veerle Baetens. In English, German, Flemish, French and Danish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-one-year-old Cyril is airlifted to hospital after a car crash which required him to be cut from his car. Meanwhile, the medical team treat 57-year-old Caroline, who arrives at St George's with chest pains, plus five-year-old Roman has a pencil stuck in his ear.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Mechanic Grant, 34, is rushed in after being crushed against a brick wall by his own car, which he was working on at the time. Doctors are concerned he has a serious pelvic injury and other internal wounds and work quickly to establish how severe they are. Meanwhile, 44-year-old Doug, who has a rare growth on his head and face which is prone to profuse bleeding, arrives in A&E, and 23-year-old cage fighter Charlie is treated in minor injuries for something in his eye.(n)

programme.title: Winged Seduction: Birds of Paradise
programme.desc: National Geographic photographer Tim Laman and ornithologist Ed Scholes have spent the better part of a decade sleeping in tents and dangling from the rain forest canopy to document all 39 species of Birds of Paradise. Their mission takes them into the jungles of one of last wild places on earth, New Guinea - where children carry machetes, women carry heavy loads and men carry on tribal warfare. Far-flung islands, impenetrable jungle and extreme elevations all create areas of isolation where ordinary birds have evolved into some of the most beautifully bizarre species on earth. Tim and Ed's first quarry on this expedition is Goldie's Bird of Paradise - a dazzling color-shaker that attracts females with a mating dance done in pairs. Rough seas, a flooded island and inaccurate scouting all stand in their way, but Tim and Ed make natural history filmmaking history by capturing a Goldie display with a remote controlled camouflaged camera. After a wild flight into the Huon Mountains, they search out Wahne's Parotia, a shape-shifter that transforms from bird to a feathered man in a skirt. Tim and Ed are after a scientific first - filming the Parotia from the female's perspective. Feathers that look like a skirt from the side, look like an oval from above, where the female audience members sit - no human has ever filmed it before. Digital explorers on an old-fashioned quest, Tim and Ed have survived everything the jungle has to throw at them to become first in the world to capture all 39 species of Birds of Paradise(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Conwy.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team travel to a village in Conwy, north Wales, to help a widower finish building his home. Since the death of his wife and being diagnosed with cancer, David Williams has been unable to work on the property and lives in a caravan with his young daughter Erica - so the crew helps to make the house habitable with the support of the local community and traders.(n)

programme.desc: The daily workings of the high-end London designer, which has supplied jewellery to the royal family since the reign of Queen Victoria. Over one summer on New Bond Street, the sales team tempts VIP customers with one-of-a-kind, gem-encrusted handbags selling for an average price of £33,000, while in the workshop above, silversmiths are seen making much of Asprey's luxury merchandise by hand. The programme also highlights the challenge of crafting a three-piece jewellery suite to hit the shop floor on schedule.(n)

programme.title: Inside Claridge's
programme.desc: Thirty delegations from around the world arrive to stay at the hotel for the duration of the Olympics, with the red carpet being rolled out five times a day for heads of state. World-famous Danish eatery Noma sets up a pop-up restaurant in the ballroom and Claridge's chefs are faced with providing Nordic-foraged food to thousands of guests who have paid £195 each. A couple fly in from Atlanta for the wedding of their dreams and a butler prepares a suite for one of the hotel's most valued guests, bringing furniture, hat boxes and 20 suits out of storage for just one night. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Psychological profiles of Wesley Shermantine and Loren Herzog. In 1984, the childhood friends embarked upon a drug-fuelled killing spree that terrorised their rural Californian community for 15 years. Psychologists and criminology experts analyse their motives and examine whether their upbringings contributed to their crimes.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: Having unearthed the secrets of five of the world's most influential cities, former diplomat Christopher Meyer returns home to London for the concluding programme. He meets Russian-born media tycoon Evgeny Lebedev, who talks about the state of the newspaper business and its influence on government. Meyer then explores the modern face of politics in the English capital with former MP and author Louise Mensch, before chatting to Mayor Boris Johnson, who explains why London is simply the greatest city in the world.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor tours the rooms, restaurants and bars where the rich and famous have lived, died and fallen in love, checking in to Bastille's L'Hotel in Paris where Oscar Wilde spent his last days. He travels to New York's Chelsea Hotel, where long-term residents included Mark Twain, Stanley Kubrick, Edith Piaf, Sid Vicious and Robert Mapplethorpe. Richard also heads to the Dorchester in London's Mayfair, where Britt Ekland shares her memories of meeting and falling for Peter Sellers there in 1964.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet continues the Press leak investigation to find out how information about the military shuttle became common knowledge. CJ is interviewed by White House counsel, Donna asks Josh for a job and Santos questions his choice of Leo as running mate. Martin Sheen and Bradley Whitford star.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: A grand jury is convened to investigate the military shuttle leak, and Vinick is in charge of smoothing things over as the campaign's focus switches to national security. Santos, however, is forced to distance himself from events while remaining loyal to the administration. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Jimmy Smits.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A frail mother consumed with guilt asks Rush to reopen the investigation into the murder of her gay son so the killer can be brought to justice before she dies. As the detective moves forward with the case, she learns about the poor treatment of homosexual victims by police in the 1960s. Detective drama, starring Kathryn Morris and John Finn.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A prosecutor suffers from what he believes to be cardiac arrest during an interrogation at the witness stand. The team's preliminary diagnosis is hyper-anxiety, but when Adams and Park investigate the patient's home and find a hidden arsenal of firearms, they uncover a more alarming and deep-seated psychological disorder. Park also begins to emerge out of her social shell, while Foreman's lack of romantic relationships piques the interest of Taub and Chase. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: The suspect in a murder trial holds Erin and the rest of her courtroom at gunpoint and Danny becomes the lead hostage negotiator as he tries to save his sister. Jamie goes against his lieutenant's direct orders and accompanies a traumatised child to hospital, leading to a suspension for his disobedience, and Frank has to decide what punishment needs to be levied against his youngest son.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Three weeks into the presidential campaign, Santos pulls off a coup that raises his approval ratings, while Vinick ignores warnings of a possible assassination brought to him by an eager NSA agent. The pair compete to bring each other down as they deliver their messages of the week. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Jimmy Smits.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: When his peace plan for the Middle East is jeopardised by the assassination of a Palestinian leader, President Bartlet insists on attending the funeral despite concerns over his security. Meanwhile, CJ receives disturbing news from a member of the intelligence community. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Allison Janney.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush receives an anonymous phone call from a man who claims to have murdered his grandmother many years previously and buried her body in the basement of his former home. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: An Alzheimer's patient takes part in a clinical trial, but unexpected side-effects trigger an explosive temper and expose a conflict between him and his wife. Meanwhile, House confronts new boss Foreman, and Wilson treats a patient who claims to be in a chaste marriage. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate when a teenage girl dies after being hit by an underground train and uncover evidence that the girl had been a victim of cyber bulling. Frank clashes with the newly appointed inspector general of the NYPD after Erin brings forward evidence that Jamie's partner Eddie may have lied about the details of her first arrest. Guest starring Bebe Neuwirth (Frasier).(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago.(n)

programme.title: Alan Partridge's Scissored Isle
programme.desc: One-off, spoof documentary in which Steve Coogan's perennially over-reaching broadcaster heads to the nebulous `north' to see how the other half live. Seeking to make amends for a controversial on-air gaffe, in which Alan apparently managed to offend anyone who considers themselves a `northerner', Norwich's finest sets out to immerse himself in the lives of the very people he slighted, as he investigates what he refers to as the `schasm' between the UK's haves and the have-nots, perhaps even transforming himself into a sought-after TV star in the process.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: New series. Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon set off on a coast-to-coast road trip through Spain, starting with the picturesque port village of Getaria.(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver
programme.desc: American talk show in which British comedian, actor and writer John Oliver presents a satirical look at the biggest news stories, political developments and pop culture events of the previous seven days. The topical series sees the former Daily Show reporter offer his distinct take on a variety of social, political and existential issues facing society.(n)

programme.desc: Adam shares some news with Hannah, while Jessa spends a day alone.(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Catherine and Marjorie have a fight, while Mike prepares for his babies. Elsewhere, Selina is interviewed. Starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Introverted and socially awkward computer programmer Richard lives with his friends and fellow tech-geeks Big Head, Gilfoyle and Dinesh under the watch of Erlich, an eccentric dotcom millionaire who lets them stay in his house in exchange for a 10 per cent stake in all their projects. His career is going nowhere fast until it becomes clear that a revolutionary data-compression algorithm he created could be worth huge sums of money and he finds himself caught in the middle of a bidding war. Comedy co-created by Mike Judge, starring Thomas Middleditch and TJ Miller.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Brixham residents raise money for a statue to commemorate fishermen lost at sea, but Pat Seddon's plan to support the cause by participating in a fundraising skydive worries her friends and relatives. Jan Hart goes trawling for scallops, and shares some ancient superstitions.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Pat Seddon considers selling up and visits a clairvoyant, while celebrity chef Mitch Tonks makes an appearance at Brixham's Crab Festival.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Three weeks into the presidential campaign, Santos pulls off a coup that raises his approval ratings, while Vinick ignores warnings of a possible assassination brought to him by an eager NSA agent. programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Kate confronts Charles Frost over the conversation he had with CJ. Meanwhile, everyone else tries to come to terms with the identity of the informer, and Babish's questioning of Toby forces him to seek legal advice. Political drama, starring Mary McCormack and Richard Schiff.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Vinick faces a dilemma after a pro-life organisation condemns Santos and he is forced to choose between throwing his support behind the advert and offending an important pressure group. Will has a tough time on his first day as Toby's replacement dealing with press briefings about the shuttle leak.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush re-examines the case of a hitch-hiker murdered in Atlantic City, New Jersey, in 1997 to see if it sheds any light on two more recent killings. Police drama, starring Kathryn Morris and John Finn.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The team is forced to perform invasive surgery on a homeless girl, and discovers a complex relationship with her mother when she arrives at her estranged daughter's bedside. Meanwhile, Taub has a difficult time trying to connect with his infant daughters. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie and Peter Jacobson.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate the kidnapping of a child whose parents aren't as willing to co-operate with the detectives as they would like. But when links to a Croatian mobster are discovered, their reticence becomes more understandable. Meanwhile, Jamie and Eddie go undercover in a jewellery shop in an attempt to stop a string of robberies, and Frank tries to help an NYPD chaplain who admits to being in crisis following his arrest for drink-driving. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ser Dontos spirits Sansa out of King's Landing and rows her out to a waiting ship, and Pod gives Tyrion news of his forthcoming trial. Tywin counsels Tommen on what makes a good king and also has an offer for Oberyn Martell. Sam decides Castle Black is not a safe places for Gilly, while Jon proposes a bold plan after the wildlings send a chilling message. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys picks a champion to take on the best that Meereen has to offer and Davos has an idea about raising funds for Stannis's cause.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In King's Landing, Jaime finally visits Tyrion in jail after some persuasion from Bronn, and he also has a mission for Brienne. Daenerys tries to balance justice and mercy in Meereen. At Castle Black, Jon asks for volunteers when Ser Alliser decides to let him go to Craster's Keep to deal with the mutineers. Fantasy drama, starring Emilia Clarke, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau and Kit Harrington.(n)

programme.title: Deadwood
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the crime-riddled town call for a despotic government to rule over the commune and so Farnum is installed as mayor, with Utter as Fire Commissioner. Starring William Sanderson and Dayton Callie.(n)

programme.title: Border Security: Australia's Front Line
programme.desc: The work of Australia's customs and immigration officials, following the procedures they use to protect the country's borders from drug smugglers, illegal immigrants, potential terrorists, harmful pests and exotic diseases.(n)

programme.desc: Following Australia's traffic enforcers as they deal with high-speed chases, defiant hooligans and explosive crashes.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Holmes investigates the murder of a mathematician and the significance of a top-secret equation he was trying to decipher, while the past comes back to haunt Watson when she receives an unexpected request from the son of a former patient, shedding light on why she turned her back on a surgical career.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Five people are killed when a supermarket robbery escalates into a shooting spree, and the CSIs later find that one of the victims was a police officer. Unfortunately, their inquiries are hampered by resistance from another cop, who apparently suffers from a persecution complex - and matters are complicated by the sheer amount of evidence discovered at the crime scene.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When several unconnected people are shot at point-blank range in New York, the team is called to investigate whether it is the work of a serial killer or more than one murderer.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds

While trying to determine the extent of the damage and apprehend those responsible, the team learns the incident was a diversion so that terrorists could carry out an assassination of a VIP at a nearby hospital. Drama, starring Kirsten Vangsness.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: The Masters
programme.desc: Action from the traditional curtain-raiser to the first Major of the year, which is held on a par 27 nine-hole course within the grounds of Augusta National. Since the inception of this semi-social event in 1960, no golfer has ever won the par three contest and the Masters in the same year. Jimmy Walker was the victorious player last year when he shot a course-record total of eight under par, but could only finish tied for 29th in the main tournament.(n)

programme.title: The Masters - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the opening day from the Augusta National in Georgia, where Englishman Danny Willett begins his defence of the year's first Major. Sheffield's Willett claimed a shock win with a five-under-par 67 last year, as 2015 champion Jordan Spieth crumbled during a thrilling final round. Willett was tied for ninth place following the opening round in 2016, four shots off the blistering early pace set by Spieth, who was out on his own after a six-under-par 66.(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther Strikes Again
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau fends off a murder syndicate led by his former police chief Dreyfus, who has been driven insane by his hatred for the bungling detective. However, doing away with the lucky lawman proves harder than anticipated - even for the world's best assassins. Comedy sequel, starring Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Lesley-Anne Down, Burt Kwouk and Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: Nine Months
programme.desc: A child psychologist's well-ordered world begins to fall apart when his live-in girlfriend announces she is pregnant. Not fond of children anyway, he dreads the impact a baby will make on his life - and to make matters worse, their eccentric Russian obstetrician admits he has never delivered a baby before. Romantic comedy, starring Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Jeff Goldblum, Joan Cusack and Tom Arnold, with Robin Williams in a cameo role.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: What About Bob
programme.desc: A psychiatrist takes on a friend's client, who turns out to be a well-meaning but annoying neurotic barely able to leave his home. The patient is hugely impressed by the consultant's methods, leading him to follow the therapist on holiday, where he unwittingly proceeds to make his life hell while winning over his family. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Richard Dreyfuss, Julie Hagerty and Charlie Korsmo.(n)

programme.title: The Benchwarmers
programme.desc: Three losers who have been pushed around all their lives decide to finally stand up for themselves and rebuild their self-esteem. With the backing of a millionaire, they form their own baseball team and take part in a tournament - in which all the other competitors are children. Sporting comedy, starring Rob Schneider, Jon Heder, David Spade and Jon Lovitz.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: The Banger Sisters
programme.desc: Former rock groupie Suzette, who has stretched her wild youth well into middle age, goes in search of fellow hellraiser Vinnie. However, she is shocked to find her old friend is now a respectable housewife with two children, who has successfully kept her raucous past a secret from her family. Comedy, starring Goldie Hawn, Susan Sarandon and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Hot Pursuit
programme.desc: An uptight, accident prone police officer desperate to prove herself has to protect a gangster's widow who has agreed to give evidence against a drug lord. They end up forced to go on the run together, and are pursued across Texas by hitmen and corrupt cops. Crime comedy, starring Reese Witherspoon and Sofia Vergara.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Dope
programme.desc: A geeky teenager in an inner-city neighbourhood harbours dreams of going to Harvard. He and his friends think their social standing at school is set to improve when they get an invitation to an underground party, but the night leaves them mixed up in crime and drugs and forced to grow up fast. Crime comedy, starring Shameik Moore and Tony Revolori.(n)

programme.title: Balls of Fury
programme.desc: A table tennis champion's life falls apart after defeat at the Olympics. However, he gets the chance to redeem himself and get revenge when the FBI recruits him to infiltrate a secret underground ping-pong tournament run by an elusive criminal genius. Comedy sending up kung fu movies, starring Dan Fogler, Christopher Walken and Maggie Q.(n)

programme.title: Top Secret
programme.desc: A rock 'n' roll singer goes on tour in East Germany in the 1950s, where a scientist's daughter draws him into the world of international espionage through a French underground movement seeking to foil a Nazi plan to take over the world. Comedy, spoofing Second World War spy thrillers and Elvis movies, starring Val Kilmer, Lucy Gutteridge and Omar Sharif.(n)

programme.title: Raising Helen
programme.desc: A New York fashion designer's sister dies, leaving her the legal guardian of three children. Maintaining a glamorous Manhattan lifestyle while looking after the youngsters proves more complicated than expected, forcing her to choose between professional fulfilment and family loyalty. Comedy drama, starring Kate Hudson, John Corbett, Helen Mirren and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Lessons in Love
programme.desc: A womanising professor settles down with his younger girlfriend and their son, only for her to leave him for someone else. Her sister visits him to make sure he is being a good father and has not slipped back into old habits, but ends up falling in love with him. Romantic comedy, starring Pierce Brosnan, Salma Hayek, Jessica Alba and Malcolm McDowell.(n)

programme.title: Get Hard
programme.desc: A corrupt businessman is convicted of fraud, and given 30 days to put his affairs in order before starting a prison sentence. He assumes a black employee has a criminal past, and seeks his help in preparing for a life behind bars - not realising that the financially struggling working stiff has never broken the law in his life. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart.(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: A Playboy bunny is ejected from Hugh Hefner's mansion for being considered over-the-hill on her 27th birthday, and has to find a new home and a fresh role in life. She becomes the unlikely house mother for a dowdy college sorority, and sets about giving its inmates a pin-up style makeover and turning their social lives around. Comedy, starring Anna Faris, Colin Hanks, Emma Stone and Kat Dennings.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: A Cappella group the Barden Bellas enjoy an unprecedented run of success, until a disastrous performance sees them banned from national competitions and beset by scandal. They attempt to turn their fortunes around and redeem their legacy by competing in the World Championships of A Cappella in Copenhagen. Comedy sequel, starring Anna Kendrick and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
programme.desc: A self-promoting writer is offered a position on the staff of a New York fashion magazine thanks to his irreverent views on the world of celebrity. However, he soon discovers his opinions render him incapable of relating to the superficial personalities he is expected to work with, not to mention his egotistical boss. Comedy based on Toby Young's memoirs, starring Simon Pegg, Kirsten Dunst, Jeff Bridges, Megan Fox and Gillian Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: A Cappella group the Barden Bellas enjoy an unprecedented run of success, until a disastrous performance sees them banned from national competitions and beset by scandal. They attempt to turn their fortunes around and redeem their legacy by competing in the World Championships of A Cappella in Copenhagen. Comedy sequel, starring Anna Kendrick and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Awkward Sexy People
programme.desc: Two close friends who have always been unlucky in love resort to a drastic plan to turn their lives around. They decide to spend a summer indulging in as much hard drinking and casual sex as they can, in the hope that the experience will transform them into the confident people they have always longed to be. Romantic comedy, starring Adam Pally and Sarah Burns.(n)

programme.title: Summer Magic
programme.desc: A hard-up widow moves into a rambling old house in Maine, where she struggles to control her three quarrelsome children. She also has to deal with the visit of her snobbish cousin, who falls for a schoolteacher her teenage daughter has her heart set on. Disney musical comedy, starring Hayley Mills, Burl Ives, Dorothy McGuire, Una Merkel and Michael J Pollard.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: A Bug's Life
programme.desc: Well-meaning ant Flik lands his colony in trouble when he accidentally disposes of an offering meant for a swarm of greedy grasshoppers - who promptly promise a horrible revenge. Faced with the imminent destruction of the anthill, he sets out to save the situation by enlisting the help of a few would-be heroes - an out-of-work troupe of bugs from a low-rent flea circus. Pixar animation, with the voices of Dave Foley, Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: Riley's First Date
programme.desc: Emotions run high when a boy shows up at the front door asking for Riley. Pixar short featuring the characters from Oscar-winning animation Inside Out, with the voices of Kyle MacLachlan, Diane Lane and Kaitlyn Dias.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: John Carter
programme.desc: An American Civil War soldier is transported to an alien planet, which is also being torn apart by conflict. He intercedes in this struggle after rescuing a princess from captivity, and must win the trust of a fierce primitive tribe to save the world. Fantasy adventure based on Edgar Rice Burroughs' series of novels, starring Taylor Kitsch and Lynn Collins.(n)

programme.title: McFarland, USA
programme.desc: A former American football coach takes a job at an underprivileged school with a mostly Hispanic student body, and finds he has a lot to learn about their lives. When he discovers many of his pupils have a talent for running, he forms an athletics team and leads them to glory. Fact-based drama, starring Kevin Costner and Ramiro Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam grudgingly undertake a bizarre mission - to help their native hosts by transporting a fully-grown elephant through 200 miles of rough jungle terrain. They soon hit upon a novel way of delivering the beast, deciding to load it into a plane, and then parachute it to its destination. Comedy, starring Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary and Doug E Doug.(n)

programme.title: Party Central
programme.desc: Monsters University animated short, in which Mike and Sulley return to the college to see how their old friends are doing, and help them to throw a wild party. With the voices of John Goodman and Billy Crystal.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: Dug's Special Mission
programme.desc: Short animated comedy, featuring characters from Up. The talking dog's fellow canines try to get rid of him by setting him a series of pointless tasks - but the plan keeps backfiring on them. With the voices of Bob Peterson, Delroy Lindo and Jerome Ranft.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch
programme.desc: A manic, mischievous alien escapes from the galactic police and crash-lands his spaceship on Hawaii. A lonely little girl mistakes the stranded creature for a dog and adopts him - but alien and Earth authorities are soon combing the island in search of him. Disney animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Partly Cloudy
programme.desc: Pixar animated short about a stork delivering babies created by a cloud, but who starts to wish he had a different source when his cargo always turns out to be a dangerous animal.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Day & Night
programme.desc: Animated short film from Pixar, in which the upbeat, cheerful embodiment of day and the moody, bad-tempered personification of night have a personality clash. However, as they get over their suspicion of each other, they begin to get a new perspective on the world.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
programme.desc: The son of the canine couple leaves home to join a pack of rough-and-ready strays, but he soon discovers the grass is not always greener on the other side. Animated sequel, with the voices of Scott Wolf, Alyssa Milano, Jodi Benson and Jeff Bennett.(n)

programme.title: Sanjay's Super Team
programme.desc: Bored with his father's meditation, a young Indian boy daydreams of Hindu gods as superheroes. Animated short, with the voices of Brent Schraff, Sunny Singh Attar, Arun Rao and Jaquelynn Herrera.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland: A World Beyond
programme.desc: A boy genius in the 1960s finds his way into a spectacular futuristic metropolis while attempting to promote his idea for a jetpack. Decades later, he has grown into a disillusioned adult, while a girl who has the talent and enthusiasm he has lost also finds her way into this strange new world, and together they attempt to uncover its secrets. Fantasy adventure, starring George Clooney, Britt Robertson and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa quits the ring to marry his sweetheart and become a father. However, times prove hard and money is tight, so when Balboa is offered another shot at Apollo Creed's heavyweight title, the fighter is lured out of retirement. Drama sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire, Carl Weathers, Burt Young and Burgess Meredith.(n)

programme.title: Lawrence of Arabia
programme.desc: An enigmatic British Army officer tries to unite the Arab nations against the Turks during the First World War, but comes into conflict with the military authorities when he engages the enemy with guerrilla tactics instead of more conventional methods. However, his increasingly torn loyalties leave him close to madness. Oscar-winning epic drama directed by David Lean, starring Peter O'Toole, Omar Sharif, Anthony Quinn, Alec Guinness and Jack Hawkins.(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Conflict erupts between the defenders of a kingdom and an invading horde that has travelled from a dying world. Fantasy adventure based on the best-selling computer game, starring Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: A soldier of fortune joins an academic and her conniving brother on an expedition to an ancient Egyptian lost city. The explorers accidentally cause the spirit of a vengeful priest with awe-inspiring supernatural powers to rise from his tomb, leading to a desperate battle for survival. Fantasy action adventure, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo and Oded Fehr.(n)

programme.title: X-Men 2
programme.desc: Mutant heroes the X-Men are forced into an uneasy alliance with arch-enemy Magneto to battle a common foe. Following an attempt on the president's life, a sinister military scientist launches a raid on Professor Xavier's school and hatches a plan to rid the world of all mutants. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Hugh Jackman, Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Alan Cumming, Halle Berry and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: Extraction
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is kidnapped by a terrorist organisation. His son, a government analyst turned down for field service, defies his superiors to mount his own rescue mission. He finds himself battling international assassins and top secret agents to save his father and prevent a terror attack. Action thriller, starring Kellan Lutz, Bruce Willis and Gina Carano.(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Conflict erupts between the defenders of a kingdom and an invading horde that has travelled from a dying world. Fantasy adventure based on the best-selling computer game, starring Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: A soldier of fortune joins an academic and her conniving brother on an expedition to an ancient Egyptian lost city. The explorers accidentally cause the spirit of a vengeful priest with awe-inspiring supernatural powers to rise from his tomb, leading to a desperate battle for survival. Fantasy action adventure, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo and Oded Fehr.(n)

programme.title: The Patriot
programme.desc: Retired soldier Benjamin Martin, who turned his back on the military to become a farmer in South Carolina, takes up arms once more to avenge the unprovoked murder of his son at the hands of the British during the American War of Independence. As he seeks vengeance, he finds himself up against a sadistic officer wreaking havoc in the surrounding area. Roland Emmerich's action adventure, starring Mel Gibson, Jason Isaacs, Heath Ledger and Joely Richardson.(n)

programme.title: Tracers
programme.desc: A New York bike messenger ends up heavily in debt to Chinese gangsters, and needs to make a lot of money quickly. Salvation arrives when he joins a gang of criminals, who use their parkour skills to pull off a series of seemingly impossible heists. Action adventure, starring Taylor Lautner and Marie Avgeropoulos.(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride
programme.desc: The one-time leader of the gunslinging band, now a marshal, turns down an old ally's call for help in dealing with a gang of Mexican bandits. However, when the desperados kill his friend and his own wife, the lawman puts together a new team and sets out to take revenge. Western sequel, with Lee Van Cleef, Stefanie Powers, Mariette Hartley and Michael Callan.(n)

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: A talented martial arts expert gets entangled with a tenacious undercover reporter as he takes part in an illegal fighting tournament, where the last man standing wins the day - and the losers usually end up in the cemetery. Action adventure, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Donald Gibb, Leah Ayres, Norman Burton and Roy Chiao.(n)

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: World heavyweight boxing champion Rocky Balboa settles down into a life of luxury - but a cloud appears on the horizon in the shape of ambitious contender Clubber Lang, whose brutal fighting style represents a serious threat to his title. Drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Mr T, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young, Carl Weathers and Hulk Hogan.(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: Eric and fellow warrior Sara, raised as members of ice Queen Freya's army, try to conceal their forbidden love as they fight to survive the wicked intentions of both Freya and her sister Ravenna. However, as war between the siblings escalates, Eric and Sara unite with Freya in an attempt to end Ravenna's wicked reign once and for all. Fantasy adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron, Emily Blunt and Jessica Chastain.(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin, who exists at the beck and call of a mysterious organisation, fails in his latest mission, and becomes a target himself, as security forces worldwide become aware of his existence and a rival agent is assigned to tie up loose ends. Action thriller, starring Timothy Olyphant, Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko.(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
